quests.name: Like a Rock
quests.description: Okay. Okay okay, those wood tools aren't the best. Kinda weak. Weak but...sturdy? Brittle? Sevicable! Let's go with that term! Anyways, I need more samples! Lets get some samples of the local rocks. You might have to dig around in some gravel for more samples, too.                                               In return, I'll send the last of the Field Kit! Well, not the MRE, yuck. I put in part of my lunch for you instead.

quests.name: Soil Samples
quests.description: Oh oh, there you are! Good, is good, this is working good. I'm Biologist Bitsy. The QUEST Tablet scanner shows that your place is BIIIG. Big big, yes. This is good! Can you grab me a few samples? Dirt and sand and gravel and stuff. Stuff is good! You can use your mitts to gather the basic stuff to start with.                                     I have a few spare pieces of a Field Kit you can have. I'll find more for you while you search around...

tasks.longDescription: Get me these samples and I'll send you some gear we use for fieldwork...if I can find them.                Ah, found a few pieces, I'm pretty sure there is more, though!

quests.name: Technology Research
quests.description: I did some deeper scans of the metal and ore from earlier. Super interesting! It seems theres a lot more metal out there. Not just metal, either! A wide variety of great materials! Sharper! Heavier! Stronger! Faster! Other than iron, there seem to be two other common metals there. Our Research and Development division would like a sample of these, please!

tasks.longDescription: Both Copper and Tin shouldn't be terribly deep in the ground.

quests.name: Rolling the Dice
quests.description: Bandit, I know you haven't been with The Ferret Business long (thus starting in the ah...more questionable experimental labs...) so you hadn't earned access to the Corporate Shop yet. Now that you have earned it, let me show you one of The Business' biggest sellers : The Blind Bag of Blind Bags!! Inside this can either be one of hundreds of different items or...Another blind bag! No, not another one of THESE, that'd be recursive recursive recursive! No, instead you'll get one of the OTHER Blind Bags we make! These contain so many more items that, well...last I looked at our internal records, we had so many different Blind Bags, it'd make your head spin! Last week I found a bar of Gold in one. Gold! Here, I'll sell you a Blind Bag at a heavy discount. I think this one is the BEST blind bag, even though its the cheapest, because it literally has the chance to have one of ANYTHING in it!                                Blind Bags of Blind Bags come in 5 Tiers : Basic, Good, Greater, Epic, and Legendary.                              If you've lost your coins from a mishap...well, the General Store should be open. Listen to Proprieter Penny's spiel, and she should open up the rest of the Corporate Shop to you...including Supply and Demand, which can be very...lucrative.

tasks.longDescription: The Blind Bag of Blind Bags is super popular. Each Blind Bag you can get can vary in quality between Cheap, Decent, Good, and Amazing. The cheapest BBoBB is the most popular, as you can get ANY quality of Blind Bag from it, even though you run the risk of not even getting a Blind Bag! You might get a rock...

quests.name: Its The Name of the Game
quests.description: So, I analyzed all those rocks and stuff you sent me. I found traces of metals. Lots of metals. Lots and lots of different metals! Metals are useful! You can make better tools! And probably better armor and stuff too.                       Get me some samples of the unrefined Iron, as well as shaped samples (A pick and a sword should do fine), and I'll open up the Corporate Shop for you. I'll also give you some Iron back since I'm not sure of the quality of your Iron yet. Or you can take some extra coins instead, it's up to you!

tasks.longDescription: Many resources like entire Tree trunks and Veins of Ore can be mined in a single go by Sneaking when you break them with the appropriate tool!
This Iron seems to have some...interesting properties to it! It feels almost...magical? Interesting...

quests.name: Material Matters
quests.description: Okay, so I checked out that soil. Very soily. Very good. Rich, even! There should probably be plantlife around you. Anything resembling a tree? Wait, actual trees? Excellent, excellent! This is great! Go knock one down and make some tools for me! No better way to see the quality of materials you have.                      I think I've found a few more pieces of the Field Kit as well! They should help replace the tools you're sending me.

tasks.longDescription: When you open your inventory, you should have a large panel of items to the right. This is Not Enough Items (NEI), which allows you to search through the thousands of items in this modpack, and find out what the recipe is for them. Use the black search bar at the bottom, and then you can left click on an item(or highlight it and hit R) to the right to see how to make it!

quests.name: Natural Research
quests.description: Okay. Okay yes. The tablet's scanners show a whole abundance of life all around you. This is good. It means you won't starve cause you can eat some of it! But it's also bad. Cause some of it can eat you! The entire corporate wing I work in is very interested in what living things you can find. Get me some biological stuff and I'll pass around my findings.

tasks.longDescription: Fruit can be found hanging from many trees. Raw meat? Well, there is a thing about tipping over cows...

quests.name: Magic Research
quests.description: Strange. Very strange. Peculiar, even! I detect once-living creatures walking around! Our Occult wing would like to investigate these things a bit closer. Seems that might mean there are some...less than 'logically scientific' things there. Grab some of the flesh off a few of those walking corpses for us.

quests.name: Shiny Flowers?
quests.description: Theres a lot of flowers around you. I mean...a lot. I had to filter your scanner a bit cause there are so many different flowers! But the biggest ones that seem to stand out? Those shiny, colorful ones! There seem to be one of every major color....why not grab me a few of them?

quests.name: Botania - Magical Flowers!
quests.description: Okay, the few flowers that Biologist Bitsy sent me were very interesting! I see there are about 16 different species scattered about... Could you send me, say, five of any of them? They should glow very slightly, hard to miss!                There also seems to be a tall variety of them, but are a bit more fragile. Use Shears on those to collect them!

tasks.longDescription: They seem to like to grow in bunches. Be sure to gather as many as you can, we can figure out how to grow them ourselves later.

quests.name: Crush a bit...
quests.description: These flowers are gorgeous! They've caught the eye of a few assistants...and of the CEO. He's requisitioned a lab and greenhouse for my newly formed team. We've been researching, and I just sent you a modified version of the "Book Model" of the QUEST Tablet called the Lexica Botania. It's connected to our systems here, and we can share research with each other this way! Why Botania? Thats the name of this new corporate position! Botaniason Belle, thats me! The book will explain a lot more, so lets get started...

tasks.longDescription: Craft a couple flowers to get their petals. Any color will do, really.                                           You can Right Click a petal on the ground to 'bury' it, and it will make the ground shimmer in that color a bit. If you use some Bone Meal on this, it will grow into a Double Flower! This is great for multiplying colors you already have.
Combining a Pestle and Mortar with a petal will grind it down into powder. A lot of these powders also double as Dyes!
Mix two petals worth of powder and some ground bones together.       You can use this in a grassy area like you would Bonemeal, and it will grow a handful of Mystical Flowers for you!

quests.name: Botaniason Tools 1
quests.description: Now that we can grow more Flowers (unreliably, but still!), we can more earnestly begin to research them. Just in our initial tests, the Flowers are amazing in of themselves, but we were quick to discover just how magical they were! One of the assistants was using a large Stone bowl full of warm water to see if he could infuse the water with Magic. He says he got lost just watching the Petals swirling around (I admit, it IS quite calming!). He was so lost to it, he took out a snack of some roasted Seeds (Quite the OSHA violation I have to say...) and accidently dropped some into the bowl.                                            Suddenly the Water, the Petals, and the Seeds vanished in a puff of magic, and the assistant found a strange, new Flower in his hand! He quickly planted it to observe it, and noticed it had a strange effect on the Logs and Stones around it...

tasks.longDescription: The Petal Apothecary is the best way to use this new magical ability. You can fill it by Right Clicking a Bucket of Water onto it, or dropping the item itself on top.         You then toss the petals or other items (hold them in your hand and press Q to throw). When looking at the Apothecary, it will show you what components are swirling around, and if they make anything. Quite handy!                                     An even handier thing : If you refill the Apothecary with Water and Right Click with an Empty Hand within 20 seconds, you'll readd the same ingredients you used to create the last Flower (if they are in your inventory that is!). Super useful for crafting a lot of Flowers in a row!

Toss four Mystical White Petals into the Apothecary. Then toss a Seed into the Apothecary, and out will pop a new Flower!                       If you are having a tough time finding regular Seeds, you can transform almost any seed into one by combining it with some Floral Powder.

Place the Pure Daisy on a bit of Dirt or Grass, and surrounded it with either Stone or Logs. After a bit, the Pure Daisy will transform them into something new!                    Could you send me some samples of both?
The Living Wood and Stone seem to be infused with some sort of energy, so lets try making something with it...
The color of the petals you craft the wand with will change the actual wand colors. The Wand has two modes : Function and Bind, and you can swap between them by Sneak + Right Clicking.
If you are finding your pockets a bit full with Mystical Flowers, you can craft this Flower Pouch to hold them!

quests.name: Sun and Moon Flowers
quests.description: So....we've been testing the Petal Apothecary a bit more after that 'sunflower seed' incident / breakthrough. What kind of seeds can be the catalyst are a bit confusing, but we've found that the Floral Powder can be combined with almost any seed to transform it into a basic Seed.                            We've found two new flowers that seem to generate that "Energy" we mentioned before. Coincidently, the two seem to be opposites of each other as well! They only live for a few days after being planted, though, but I don't doubt we can find more hearty flowers than these two. Its a good start though!

tasks.longDescription: This Flower creates Mana during the day, as long as it can see the sky!
This Flower generates Mana during the night, as long as it can see the star-filled sky!

quests.name: Energy Control
quests.description: Very interesting! Those Day Blooms and Nightshades really go to town! Our scanners show that 'energy' builds nicely during over the course of the day. You know, it really needs a better name...well, lets call it Mana since this is still technically an 'occult' wing of The Business.                                     We should find a way to collect and harness this Mana, and I think making a large vessel of Living Stone and some tools from the Living Wood should work. We can also shape these materials and turn them into something to help us utilize this Mana.

tasks.longDescription: This looks good, and should hold a good amount of Mana.

tasks.description: Kind of like a Solar Oven?
tasks.longDescription: When a Mana Spreader has enough Mana, it will 'fire' it out where it is aiming. We call this a Mana Burst. You can select a Mana Spreader by holding your Wand of the Forest and Sneak + Right Clicking on it while in Bind mode. It will have a rainbow box around it. You can then target where it's aiming with Sneak + Right Clicking the target. Mana Pools cannot gather Mana themselves, you'll need to use a Spreader to transfer Mana from the flowers to one. You can also Right Click any Wool onto the Mana Spreader to both decorate it and muffle the shooting sound.

The normal Mana Pool is quite useful, but I think we can make a slightly smaller one in capacity. It'd be quite helpful in determining how much Mana we're generating over time, for example.                            Oh, a fun thing we found out! If you Right Click any color of Floral Powder into the Mana Pool, it will dye it that color!

Now that we have some Mana and a place to store it, we can see what happens when we dip various items into it.                                          First thought to us was try a bit of Redstone, which is slightly Magical in its own way, and we ended up with this interesting, blue version we're calling Mana Powder!

This Mana Powder gives us even more to work with in finding new flowers, like this Endoflame! It burns solid fuel like Coal dropped near it to generate a Mana much faster than the Dayblooms and Nightshades!

quests.name: Manipulation of Mana
quests.description: It takes more time than we really care for to examine how each new flower we discover works, how much power its generating, etc. We've worked in a bit of older technology into our research, the Redstone Dust technology. With it, we've been able to create devices that let us detect, spread, and remove Mana from what we are calling a Mana Network. During this research, we've also discovered a new Flower that will detect if your Mana Network is either gaining or losing Mana.

tasks.longDescription: When a Mana Burst travels through this device, it will emit a Redstone signal.
The Distributor only spreads the mana to pools that are touching it. Make sure not to accidently block the Mana Bursts with one of the pools!
Any Mana Burst that hits this device is destroyed. Completely. Never existed!
When this Flower is Blue, it means the Mana Network it is on is gaining Mana. If it is Red, well, better find what's draining your Mana.
When worn in your Amulet slot, this Monocle allows you to see Mana Bursts, even if something else is in the way.

Need to transport your Mana long distances? Well, put it on a Minecart! You can combine a Mana Pool and Minecart, and then pump Mana ino it with a Mana Pump. Mana is pulled from the Blue side of the pump and put into the Pink side of the pump. You cannot fill or empty Mana from a Mana Minecart any other way.

quests.name: Better Equipment
quests.description: One of the first things we did after discovering Manasteel is trying to forge it into tools. It seems that we can make armor, tools, and weapons out of it. Its a little stronger than Iron, and has more capacity for Enchantment. If you make and charge a Mana Tablet, the Manasteel equipment will consume Mana from it instead of taking damage. As well as protecting your Armor, a Mana Tablet can also be used in conjuction with this Blaster we devised. While you cannot fire Mana Bursts as potent as a Spreader, this makes it outright portable, which is good!

tasks.longDescription: The Vitreous Pickaxe enables you to safely remove Glass without breaking it.
If you wear all four pieces of Manasteel armor, your Mana Tools take 10% less Mana.

Any item that can hold Mana, like this Tablet, can be charged by throwing it on top of a Mana Pool set to give Mana. You can change a Pool between Giving and Taking Mana by Sneak + Right Clicking it with your Wand of the Forest.
If you have any sort of Lens, you can combine it with the Blaster as well. Just craft the Blaster itself to remove the Lens.
The Slingshot uses Vine Balls for Ammo, and will launch them pretty far. When the Vine Ball hits something, it will lower down strong Vines that can be climbed!
Combining this Cloth with an Enchanted item will remove the Enchants from it. Good when you've botched an Enchantment on a rare item!

If you don't like looking like a Mega Zero in your spiffy blue armor, or any other Mana armor, you can combine a piece of it with Phantom Ink to make it invisible! You can also make your accessories like Rings invisible!                            Combining Phantom Ink with a Phantom'd item will remove the effect.

You can upgrade the Assembly Halo by combining it with a Mana Diamond to create the Manufactory Halo.                                            When you aren't holding the Halo, it will automatically try to do every crafting recipe saved on it, on a regular basis. We've found this is a great way to automatically compress Cobblestone, or other similar things.

quests.name: Form and Function
quests.description: The Living Wood and Stone blocks you've made have a lot of amazing properties...but they also look fairly nice as well! You can arrange them in various ways to get more decorative blocks, even combine them with Seeds or Glowstone Dust to get other looks! This has inspired us to try making other materials more pleasing to look at as well! This isn't to say all some of these things do is look nice, some of them also do various interesting things as well. Maybe not quite useful, but interesting nonetheless.

tasks.longDescription: There are more patterns and designs than these. You can check them out in your Lexica Botania.

The Abstruse Platform is only solid to those who stand on top of it. If you walk through the side or under it, or Sneak while standing on it, you will drop through it. Mana Bursts will always pass through Abstruse Platforms. You can also hide the Abtruse Platform by right-clicking it with the block you wish to use as Camoflage.

The Open Crate is....only somewhat useful. If you like making a mess. Any items put into the Crate will instantly drop straight downward. Perhaps more useful, if you supply it a Redstone Signal, any item it drops won't be picked up by another Flower for a short bit.
We basically put a Mana Spreader onto a Piston and turned it up. For what? To spread Mana to Pools at a distance, of course!
Want to access your Ender Chest from anywhere? Use this Hand! ((Note that the recipe requies a vanilla Ender Chest, one that is made with mostly Obsidian))
You can combine 9 of one petal color to make a decorative block.

quests.name: Quartz Conundrum
quests.description: The Quartz you can find in the Nether has quite a lot of uses. It is also quite pretty when used to decorate with, and we've been able to combine it with various materials to give you even more decorative ideas! You can even throw it into a Plain Mana Pool to infuse it. If you throw it into a Mana Pool augmented with a Catalyst, though, you get something completely different!

tasks.longDescription: These special varieties of Quartz can be made into Blocks and Slabs and Pillars just like regular Quartz.
You can arrange Quartz into a patterned block called an Azulejo. You can rearrange the patterns of it in a dozen different ways by simply crafting the Azulejo itself.
Quartz infused in a Mana Pool with an Alchemical Catalyst creates Prismarine. You can combine these into a Block, and you can also combine them with a Glowstone Block to create a lovely Lantern.

There are four special stone varients you can make as well, sort of a glimpse into the future. The first you can get by tossing Stone into an Alchemy augmented Mana Pool, then each result can be thrown in again for a different one. You can then turn these into Polished versions, as well as Stairs and Slabs the normal way.

quests.name: Wild Creations
quests.description: My assistants have been quite busy lately exploring all the possibilities Botania has to offer us. Most of what we've found has to deal some way with Nature, which isn't surprising given this is a Flower basic magic system. To that, we have created a good handful of various tools, items, and implements for you.                                        One assistant has found a way to easily change the lands into Mycellium or Podzol, letting you enrich the ground around you. Another assistant has created quite pretty decorations in their effort to discover more uses. My last assistant has been combining music theory with his research, and while somewhat odd, he has come up with a few items of his own to help you!

tasks.longDescription: There are three normal types of Pasture Seeds and six special types. Each will instantly grow Grass or more on Dirt.                    The normal Pasture Seeds turn dirt or grass into some common types : Pasture grows Grass, Boreal grows Podzol, and Infested grows Mycellium.                              The six special Pasture Seeds make decorative grass variants. For example, Mutated Pasture Seeds make a purpley looking Grass!

By coating a Mystical Flower in Glowstone Dust, you get a Glowing Mystical Flower, which emits light. By adding it to some dirt with a Pasture Seed, you make it its own floating island! You can then combine this Floating Flower with any flower with an effect to place THAT flower on the island instead!

Making a horn out of Livingwood and decorating it with a Pasture Seed creates a powerful Horn. When blown, will uproot all vegetation nearby, dropping Seeds and Plants for you to retrieve. Combine the Horn with some Leaves, and instead the Horn will destroy Leaves. Combining the Horn with a Snowball will instead let it destroy Snow.

By encasing a Horn in Livingwood, and topping it with Leather to create a Drum, you get a stationary device that reacts to Mana Bursts. When one hits it, it acts as if you blew the original Horn itself.

These little Sparks of life are somewhat handy! You can place one on top of a Mana Pool, then another on any device that requires Mana (That you'd usually hit with a Mana Burst, for example), and it can instead tap into the Mana Pool's reservoir, as long as it isn't too far away.

quests.name: Power Tools
quests.description: Bandit, a lot of the different research areas of The Business have been sharing your findings with each other. Various labs are requesting ways to convert Mana into their respective power systems. There are very few ways we've found, unfortunately, but there are three things we ARE able to help them with. One converts to the most common power system currently, one doesn't convert Mana, but instead translates movement across a distance, and the last one is...well, its more of just a morale booster.

tasks.longDescription: This block converts Mana directly into RF Energy. Unfortunately, this conversion is only ONE way. You cannot convert RF back into Mana.

You can infuse a Piston with Mana, and then Bind it (like a Mana Spreader) to another block. The Piston will still push this item back and forth as if it were in front of the Piston. Initially not that useful, but we discovered we could move the Mana infused Piston around and it would not effect the Bound block.
This little guy is cute. No idea what he does other than look cute. Isn't that enough?                           Hey, you can even name it on an Anvil! I wonder if certain names would....

The Assembly Halo lets you craft on the go, without having to place down a Workbench all the time. Holding the Halo will show you a ring around you. Right click the Workbench to start crafting, loading the last recipe you made with it if you have all the pieces. Right clicking an empty spot on the Halo will save the saved recipe to it, and you can right click this area to craft it again if you have the parts. Empty a saved recipe by Sneak + Left Clicking it.
The Livingwood Bow will fire normal arrows like any other standard bow, but it will also repair itself with Mana.
The Blaze Lamp condenses Blaze Rods into a light source. It can also be used as a Solid Fuel, or turned into Obsidian by a Pure Daisy.

Keeping an accurate timer is easily done with computers, but it lacks...elegance and a bit of magic, you know? So, we came up with this Hourglass. By inserting sand into it, it will tick down and emit a Redstone pulse before flipping itself over.        How long depends on how much and what kind of sand you add. Regular Sand is 1 second each, Red Sand 10 seconds, and Soul Sand 1 minute. You can only add one type of Sand at a time, and you have to be holding the exact amount you want.                                           We'll detail this more thoroughly in your Lexica Botania.

Given the... blocky... nature of things, sometimes it is hard to build something circular in design. When done properly, it looks aesthetically pleasing! Otherwise, it just looks... lopsided?                       Well, Manasteel seems to give some special properties to normally mundane tools, and a Sextant is no different. You can hold Right Click the Worldbuilder's Sextant onto a block you want as the center of a circle, then look outward to change the size of the blue line that appears.                                        When you release Right Click, ghostly Cobblestone will appear as a building guide. Super handy! You can Right Click one of these ghost blocks with your Worldbuilder's Sextant to dismiss the guide.

quests.name: Quite a Spectacle
quests.description: Lately we've been wondering if there are ways we could alter the Mana Bursts themselves. We're creating lots of new Flowers lately, but that is only one side of the equation, right? Well, two sides, some Flowers MAKE Mana, some Flowers TAKE Mana. But what about in-between? I mean specifically the Mana Network and the Mana Bursts themselves. We decided to see if we could effect the Mana Bursts, and I decided to try making a giant Lens out of glass and Manasteel. Well, it didn't seem to do anything, until one of the assistants spilled some Dye on the lens, and suddenly the Mana Burst that passed through it turned a different color! Since then, I've had all my assistants researching and testing new Lenses. We've come up with a whole lot! We've also found you can combine two Lenses together : the Lens will look like the first one, but have the effects of both. Not all Lenses seem to work together though.

tasks.longDescription: Alone, this Lens does nothing. You can combine it with some Dye to color the Mana Burst though!

Potency increases the amount of Mana each Burst can have. Resistance will increase the time before a Mana Burst starts losing Mana. Efficiency will decrease the time, but also decrease how much Mana is lost over time.

Bounce causes Mana Bursts to bounce off objects instead of breaking on them. Gravity makes the world's gravity effect the Burst, making it arc downward. Bore enables the Burst to break blocks it hits, consuming Mana from the Burst itself.
Damaging causes the Burst to damage creatures it passes through. Kindle sets a block on Fire if it hits it, but not creatures. Entropic causes the Mana Burst to explode when it breaks on a block.

Influence will cause all nearby fallen items to move along the same vector as the Burst. Force pushes the block the Burst hits as if it was pushed by a Piston. Weight causes blocks the Burst hits to fall like Sand.
Phantom causes the Burst to pass though blocks. Velocity causes the Burst to travel much faster, but start losing Mana faster. Magnetizing causes the Burst to home in on devices that can store mana.

The Flash Lens will create a magical fire where the Burst hits. It will be colored the same as the Lens, but only provide light, as it is a decorative flame. Another Burst from a Flash Lens will put the flame out.

quests.name: Accessorizing
quests.description: Manasteel is quite pretty, I have to say. Its become a bit of a lab fashion to wear a ring or necklace of Manasteel. It also gives us a handy piece of material to test things with. It was inevitable, then, for us to consider the possibility of giving function to our form. We immediately began researching posibilities of harnessing Mana and overall magical effects we've discovered thus far in useful little packages : jewelry. True, it is a bit of a trope to have magical rings and necklaces, but we ARE working with Magic so... ((You can access your Jewelry by pressing the ring to the upper right of your portrait in your Inventory. Or you can bind a button to Baubles in your options menu))

tasks.longDescription: The Band of Aura will generate Mana slowly and put it into any Mana storing items in your inventory, such as a Mana Tablet, or the Band of Mana, which stores Mana as well.
The Soujourners Sash will make you lighter, allowing you to move faster and jump higher. The Tectonic Girdle, conversely, makes you heavier and invincible against knockback effects.

The Ring of Chordata will clear your vision when you are under water, and if you are carrying Mana in a Tablet or Ring, you'll also breath underwater. The Ring of the Mantle will speed up your hands a bit, making you mine faster.

The Pyroclast Pendant will put you out if you catch on Fire, but will not save you if stand IN Fire...or Lava for that matter. The Snowflake Pendant will turn water under your feet into Ice temporarily, but not if you are IN the water. That'd be...disasterous.

The Spectator will highlight inventories that contain the same item you are currently holding. You can also crouch, and it will highlight all dropped items around you. The Ring of Magnetization will draw in all dropped items around you when not Sneaking. It will stop magnetizing for 5 seconds if you toss an item out of your inventory.
As long as you have the Tiny Planet equipped, Mana Bursts close to you will fly towards you, then orbit around you. You can also encase it in a pedastal of Stone, to have a stationary version.

This Pendant can be used in place of a Vial in the Botanical Brewer to imbue that effect into the Pendant. While worn, the Imbued effect will consume Mana. Keep in mind not all Brews can be Imbued into a Pendant.
The Ring of Correction will automatically swap the tool you are using to one more appropriate for breaking the material you are working on. It will only works with Mana Tools though.

These accessories allow you to add more flair to your jewelry ensemble, or to change the look of your Botania accessories! There are 32 different ones, and you can combine one with any Botania accessory that goes in the same slot to change its look. You can also just wear it as it is.

Accessories are not only for you and your assistants!                  The Manatide Bellows can be connected to the side of a Mana Pool to increase the rate it outputs Mana. You can also place it against a Furnace to speed it up.                  Do note that the Bellows don't work on their own when speeding up a Furnace, you will need to man them.

With all these Accessories you can make, it feels odd to only be storing them in normal chests and boxes, you know?                            To that, we've come up with a handy Bauble Case! It's kind of like a Jewelry Case, but for Baubles! You can use it to store and swap between your various Baubles, and it can even hold Mana storing items for you.

The Planestrider's Sash is an alternate to the Sojourner's Belt. Instead of outright boosting your speed, you will speed up as you walk around.                                  If you walk enough, you will go much faster than the Sojourner's Sash or similar accessory.

quests.name: Strength of the Earth
quests.description: We've discovered quite a stronger material than the Manasteel you've been using. By infusing together Manasteel, Mana Diamonds, and Mana Pearls, along with a ton of Mana, you can create this green metal. It has great Mana harnessing ability we've found in our initial tests. To create it, you'll need to create a ritual area : a 3x3 checkerboard of Livingrock and Lapis Lazuli blocks, with a Terrastial Agglomeration Plate atop the center. Look at your Lexica Botania for a better explanation on how to do this. Meanwhile, while we do more tests, we've already created a few new tools for you to use with this new material!

tasks.longDescription: Every time you swing this Sword, it seems you have a small chance of also releasing a Mana beam that will damage your targets as well!
Instead of having to recharge a Mana Tablet all the time, you can use this Mirror. Sneak + Right click it on a Mana Pool to bind it, and it will directly draw Mana from that pool for your items.

quests.name: Otherworld Materials
quests.description: We've read the passages in your updated Lexica Botania, which now seems to be linked to the...Elven?...world. Looks like both of our groups will be giving you lots of information! The first thing we need to do is trade the Elves some of the resources they are missing and see what they give us in return.

tasks.longDescription: Like Managlass, Alfglass can be turned into Panes.

This is something the Elves mentioned to us : If we can capture the air of the world we call The End in a Glass Bottle, we can use it in various ways. Throwing it at some normal Stone seems to change it to End Stone. I think with The Business doing all this research, we should be able to make a...reasonable facimile...check your Store page.

quests.name: Magic Staves
quests.description: All these Magical creations and processes, from Alchemy to Altars to Magic Rings, have given us the idea to keep expanding on the Wizard angle of Magic. More precisely, what is a Wizard without an old, gnarly Staff that can do something Magical? Probably not old and wise enough, I guess. Or he doesn't have a bad leg or back...Where was I? Oh yes! We've utilized the power of various materials like Runes, which have created quite a variety of useful Staves for you to use.

tasks.longDescription: Aim this staff at the ground and activate it, and a low ring of Fire will appear around you. I suggest running, because after a few seconds, it won't be a small ring anymore. It will burn everything inside it...including you!
For just a bit of Mana, wherever you activate this Rod will create Water! This is especially helpful as you can use it to instantly refill a Petal Apothecary.
When you activate this, it will propel you 20 meters up into the air, and then start recharging. As long as it is recharging, you will not take fall damage.

tasks.description: Not A Jar But It Will Do
tasks.longDescription: This lets you create blocks of Dirt on the spot. As if you didn't have enough of them.
When you activate this Rod, it will highlight many Ores all around you.

While not a Staff, this Knife has a very particular set of abilities. Abilities that make it a nightmare for Endermen in your world. If you strike one with this, it will be the death of it. But if you do, you can only strike a few times, and then it will break on you.
Works like the Rod of Lands, but summons a block of Cobblestone instead.
This has the ability to change a block of material into another. Cobblestone turns into Stone, Sand into Glass, etc.

The Rod of the Shifting Crust is quite a handy tool. It allows you to swap materials placed in the world with a material in your inventory.         To select what block you want to swap to, Shift + Right Click this Rod on it. You can then Left Click any solid block with the Rod to swap it with the chosen one, as long as it is in your inventory.                           Right Clicking, though, will cause a larger transformation, swapping all highlighted blocks instead. Remember, this requires both Mana and the blocks in your inventory!        Also, if you have certain other Rods in your inventory, you can augment the Swap. Rod of the Lands, for example, will allow you to swap for Dirt infinitely, as long as you can pay the Mana cost for generating the Dirt as well.

The Livingwood Avatar is a mannequin made of Livingwood and a Mana Diamond, that can be given certain Rods and they will function similarly as if you were using them yourself.                                       A good example is the Rod of the Skies. Giving it to a Livingwood Avatar allows you or any of your Assistants the ability to jump high when near the Avatar.

quests.name: Don't Lose Your Head Over It
quests.description: You know, we're not even sure what to make of this. The Elves don't either, as its a strange combination of both of our research areas. It seems that you can combine a skeleton skull with a few mystical objects in the Runic Altar, and by adding a Name Tag with the name of another person written on it on an Anvil, you can get a faux head that looks just like theirs! Why don't you create one of The Ferret Business CEO: Caigan?

tasks.longDescription: It seems the cosmos are a bit odd in the name registry. You'll have to spell the CEO's name in lowercase : caigan. Not Caigan.

quests.name: Augmented Life
quests.description: Our research with the Pixie Dust has resulted in some strange creations, I have to say. They'd be almost alarming if they weren't also just so dang interesting. Take these two viruses for example! No, don't worry, they only effect a single creature at a time...and only horses at that. It doesn't spread...I don't think. Infecting a horse with one of these will either make it a ghostly skeletal horse, or a undead zombie horse. Either way, it seems to make them much stronger, faster, healthier, you name it! Alternatively, we've found a set of Augments that will be useful for those Sparks we discovered a while back. Each does something different to a Spark.

tasks.longDescription: Horses infected with one of the two Viruses will not take fall damage, nor will their rider.
Placing this Augment on a Spark will allow it to send Mana to objects you or o your assistants are carrying to Charge them.
A Spark with this Augment will draw Mana to its Pool from all other Mana Pools nearby that have an unAugmented Spark on them.
The opposite of the Siphon Augment, this will cause the Spark to send Mana out to all other Pool's nearby with an unAugmented Spark on them.
To prevent a Mana Pool with a Spark on it from interacting with other Augmented Sparks, you can use this Augment.

tasks.description: I Kind of Asked for This
tasks.longDescription: This interesting device allows you to change the Augments on Sparks automatically.  By placing it next to Mana Pools or other things with Sparks attatched to them, the Tinkerer will connect to those Sparks.                                          You can Right Click any augment onto the Tinkerer to add it. When a Redstone Signal hits the Tinkerer, it will randomly select a connected Spark that has a different Augment than what it is holding, and switch them.

quests.name: Pipes and Power
quests.description: The amount of materials scattered around your world has caught the attention of many different research labs and other groups within The Ferret Business. One of them is of the large group of researchers and engineers who handle a lot of the logistics for organising and supplying different departments with enough materials to keep functioning. They've requested a sample of a few common (and one...unique...) material from your world.

quests.name: Strange Equipment
quests.description: The scanners installed in your QUEST tablet show lots of interesthing things. A lot of us here are really interested in the data...but it seems you caught the attention of one of our more uh....eccentric researchers. He's asking for a sample of the old Redstone Dust your world has deep in the earth, and one of those bluegreen pearls from the lanky, creepy Endermen teleporting around at night...

quests.name: To Invent Some Extra Utilities!
quests.description: What? Whats an Inventologist you ask? Why, I am, of course! Oh, what does the term mean you mean? I mean uh...you...mean...Er, okay, Inventologists research past inventions and create new ones! The difference between me and a normal inventor? Why, the ologist part! Seven letters! Okay lets just get into the swing of things, lets see what things you can show me! Send me samples of fairly common building materials in your world...

quests.name: Inventing New Tools of Old
quests.description: One thing I've noticed with all the materials you've sent us...that is, myself and the rest of The Ferret Business...is that everything in your world seems to be suffused just a bit with a bit of Magic. This means all the materials of your world seem to...slightly bend? Yeah, slightly bend the laws of physics and logic. All these tools are normal tools we have here in our world, you've probably used some of them before your accident. But when we change the design a bit and use materials from your world? We then create all new tools! And this...this is one of the hearts of Inventology! Reworking the old into new!

tasks.longDescription: Your world's crops seem to grow faster than ours normally do. By using the magical nature of your Iron, we can create a watering can that can speed it up even faster with just a bit of water. Don't forget to fill up the Watering Can by Right Clicking some water!

tasks.description: You Could Fit A Lot In This
tasks.longDescription: By constructing a liquid Drum out of your magical Iron, we get a container that can hold much more water than it normally should. It can even hold molten Metal and Lava!

I took the old, classic design of a stovetop heating coil, and remade it slightly, adding some Redstone to it. Now this one can hold RF Energy like a battery, and power a Furnace as if it were Wood or Coal!

Usually used in older ah...military....setups, these Spikes usually are deployed against dangerous monsters, and will damage and destroy anything that lands on them. With my redesign, they hurt anyone touching them, but items don't break and vanish. Experience Orbs do not drop, though.
You can make a Wooden version of the Spikes, which will nearly kill the creature stepping on it. One good punch will finish it off.

quests.name: Classic Energy Generation
quests.description: I have an old school Generator laying around here. I've been looking at it and considering that it could probably help you a whole lot, right? So I dusted it off, and revamped it slightly. My redesign has led me to make quite a few variations on it, all able to use a different fuel source.

tasks.longDescription: The Survivalist Generator is your cheapest option. It is very fuel efficient, but very very slow in power generation. It is also quite cheap, material wise!
The upgraded version of the Survivalist Generator, this one has an average fuel to power ratio.
An advanced version of the Furnace generator, this one consumes Lava pumped into it to generate power.

Why use precious, limited Fuel when you have a sun (or multiple suns!) burning away in the sky, supplying light and power on a massive scale? NOTE : This Generator only GENERATES power or TRANSMITS power, never both at the same time. To switch from generating to transmitting, supply a Redstone signal.

Know what generates a LOT of power REALLY fast? Explosions! This Generator uses TNT to create contained... mostly contained... explosions to generate lots of power. 90% Contained Explosions! Maybe 85%... just... keep it away from anything but cables, okay?
You know, I was trying to create even more varieties of Generator and....I'm not even sure what I came up with. This one seems to consume anything that is colored with Pink Dye to generate power.

quests.name: Miniaturizing Power
quests.description: All these generators we have created are fantastically helpful, but they are a bit of an older technology. And as with older technology, as time passes, it gets more powerful AND smaller! We can condense down eight of any original Generator into a single, much more powerful Generator. It will both consume Fuel and generate RF Energy at EIGHT TIMES the rate, at 1/8th the size! Fantastic!

quests.name: Tiny Generator, Amazing Power!
quests.description: Time marches on, and Inventology leads the way! We can take the bigger Generators, and improve them by yet another factor of Eight, to create these crazy, amazingly powerful Generators!

quests.name: Magical Technology
quests.description: I've started to work more and more with all the Magical materials you have supplied me with. I wasn't getting anywhere myself, so I took a little stroll through a few of the nearby labs, as a good Inventologist tends to do to get more ideas. Well, I came across one of the newer labs, and they were inlaying Metal on circuit boards and using Quartz in various ways...The researchers were explaining to me how Quartz keeps good timing, and how it also helps in transmitting light and data and...I missed some stuff, he was talking really fast as he was pushing me to the door, also saying something about "...thats why we need controlled environments too!". Well, I got many more ideas from him and that lab that I just HAD to start work on something myself! And after a lot of hard work, some stol...borrowed... research materials and blueprints, I've definitely got something for you! One part Magic, one part Technology, all parts Inventology!

tasks.longDescription: I started by combining the sleekness of Obisidian with the mysteriousness of Ender Pearls, and created quite an alluring looking material.

I was able to find a way to imbue a Shelf of Books with the Magical properties of Enchanted Books. This morphed it into a powerful block of Magical Wood material. You can easily make some cheap Enchanted Books on a lone Enchantment Table. As a bonus, if you put this block a few meters away from one, it'll boost its power a bit!

Seeing how they inlaid Metal on silicon boards got me thinking...could we not do the same with our new materials? Instead of Quartz, we use Diamonds and the Ender-Infused Obsidian to create a Computational Matrix!

With this new Ender infused Computational Matrix, I think we can tap into the vast, mysterious dimension of the Endermen, and all the power that may contain within. This QED I've Invented is basically a powerful, otherworldy Crafting Bench, able to make special items infused with pure Ender energy.

While we can tap into the Ender's world, we can't tap into their Power with the same device. To do that we'll need to make something similar to a Generator, but will instead convert RF Energy into End Energy. Neither these Crystals nor the QED can store End Energy, so when creating something in the QED it will transfer the power at that time.

quests.name: Upgrading Your Transfers
quests.description: Our Transfer Nodes are great and all, but they can be kinda...slow, you know? They only move one meter a second when searching a network, which SEEMS fast until you have a pipe network that spans an entire aircraft hangar worth of space....To that end, I've devised several ways to upgrade your Transfer network. Whether its by increasing its speed, how many items it moves at once, or how it searches the system, I'm pretty sure you can find lots of useful things to do with these Upgrades!

tasks.description: Got a Need to Go Fast
tasks.longDescription: When searching, a node will move to the next pipe every second. Each one of these Speed upgrades will increase the pipes it moves each second by 1, maxxing out at 64 per second.

A Node only pulls a few of an item into its buffer with each operation. When you speed it up, it may only grab one or two off a stack before depositing its item and starting all over again. The Stack Upgrade will enable a Node to instead grab the entire stack of an item on the first operation.

When a Node with this upgrade hits a fork in the road, it will remember which paths it has already taken. When it hits a dead end, it will go back to the last junction and go down and unsearched path. When the entire Network is seached, only then will it restart from the beginning.
When searching with this upgrade, the Node will always start with the closest inventories first then work outward.
When searching with this upgrade, the Node will always start with the closest inventories first then work outward.

Nodes, so far, are only useful if they are connected to some sort of inventory : whether a chest or a liquid tank. With this little upgrade, though, we can attatch the nodes to something else and have them interact with the world itself! You can generate Cobblestone by attatching an Item Node to a Cobblestone, and placing a Water Source Block on one side and a Lava Source Block on the other. You can create an automated crafting system by pointing an Item Node at a basic Crafting Table, then putting a 3x3 grid of chests or barrels on the other side of the Crafting Table. Place items corresponding to a recipe, and it'll automatically craft the items for you. If you don't point the Item Node at anything, it will instead suck in dropped items slowly and pull them into an inventory, like a vaccuum. Conversely, with a Liquid Node, you can point it at a Water Source Block that has two other water source blocks next to it, and the Node will generate water steadily for you.

quests.name: Research and Invent
quests.description: We do a lot of research here in The Ferret Business, and we've had to come up with a lot of our own tools to make research easier and faster. We also tend to work with new ideas and materials and things all the time, so...necessity is the mother of invention, they say. Since it seems you have an abundance of Redstone stuff in your world, some of these should definitely help you out since its a cornerstone of our technology here, and I've also come up with one or two Inventions that should help you out quite a lot!

tasks.longDescription: The Conveyor Belt will move creatures, items, and even you and your assistants along its surface.
This Filing Cabinet can store up to 270 of the same item, even if they have minor differences (like if one was more damaged, or named). It'll list them alphabetically for you as well!

I notice you have a lot of Villages in your world, with inhabitants that like to barter and trade. With the Trading Post, the larger villages will be easier to track all the Trades with, as it will compile a list of all Trades around it, and give you an easy one stop shop for your Bartering needs.

Sometimes you have a setup with Redstone and machines that needs to pulsed with a Redstone Signal regularly. This Clock can do just that without requiring a bunch of floor space for a larger contraption.
This device can send a Redstone Pulse out if it detects a block next to it changing.
Like the Basic version, except it can also detect minute changes in something like a Machine next to it

quests.name: Magical Inventions
quests.description: Examing your materials more and more I think we can definitely exploit the Magical nature of every material you have! I've created a few little interesting things for you, things that should definitely help you since you are mostly alone out there.

tasks.description: Want To Live? Come With Me!
tasks.longDescription: Gold especially seems to be Magical in nature all on its own. By making a Lasso rope out of it, I've created a way to temporarily miniaturize any single creature. Just use the Lasso on them and pocket it, then use the Lasso again later to release the creature!

Weaving the Gold into cloth and studding it with Gemstones and making it into a Pouch seems to have a similar effect, except with Items. You can open this bag, put stuff into it, and it will store even more than you could normally carry, regardless of weight! You can also Dye the bag!

Using a special Endermen's Eye, I've constructed a little scanner you can use on various things around you to check their state. You might have to Sneak when using it on some things, but it might give you some useful data!

quests.name: A Dark Portal
quests.description: I've been tinkering more with combining Unstable material with Compressed Cobblestone, and well....I created something intriguing. The higher ups finally let me have a few assistants due to our Inventology research, and one was examining this new creation when he....well, he just vanished. He reappeared a few minutes later, looking scared but excited! He said he had appeared inside a stone box, torches already lit. He could hear...something, in the stone. He had his own QUEST Tablet on hand and ran some scans. They told him he was at what is, literally, an impossible depth for our world, and that there were massive amounts of metals and other resources around, but also an innumerable amount of dangerous creatures and hazards. It's going to take me a bit to get through the paperwork to allow me to send exploration and security teams into this Deep Dark place...but...I'm giving you the instructions on how to make this portal. If you want to take the risk, I can't stop you. Be careful and safe journeys!

tasks.longDescription: The Darkness in this new place has a life of its own. Normal Light rules concerning monster spawning do not apply. Magnum Torches and Chandeliers DO work properly though. Any other light source will not stop monsters from spawning wherever they please.

quests.name: Drum Solo
quests.description: The Iron Drums we made are fantastic and hold so much liquid in such a compact space.... but... sometimes we need to hold MORE liquid in the same amount of space. I've made other things with Bedrockium in place of Iron so....I tried it with a Drum. And boy did it exceed my expectations! These drums hold 256 times more than a regular drum!

quests.name: Etheral Accessories
quests.description: I've been given permission to build a second wing to the Inventology area of The Business, as experimenting with Unstable matter has proven...damaging. The only cavaet is the building has to be constructed by myself and the couple of assistants I've finally been granted. Not really a problem, there are a lot of various building tools at our disposal from the various research labs and tech testing wings....but I had the feeling we could construct our own building tools, you know? Heck, I think we can take on all aspects of building, from gathering materials to building really high!

tasks.longDescription: Wearing these Goggles lets you see deep into very walls around you. It will create a wireframe around the material you look directly at, up to 5 meters away, letting you see any hidden pockets of Ore or other materials.

By holding this wand and using it on placed material in the world, such as a wall of Wood, you can extend it out automatically! You have to have the same material in your inventory, though, you cannot just make something out of nothing.
When building, or heck, even when moving around, a lot of times its useful to have a ladder. Or wings! The latter being vastly more useful and just more fun! And now, with Unstable material, you can!

quests.name: Golden Improvements
quests.description: Magical Wood is, well, quite Magical. Just how Magical we already know from its use in the QDS, but it can also be used to upgrade a couple other things you have.

tasks.longDescription: You seem to be able to come back from the dead easily in your world, but your equipment and backpack do not. By infusing a Bag of Holding with Magical Wood, you can respawn with the Bag itself at least! You'll have to empty the bag, though, for the QUEST Tablet to scan it properly.
This improved Filing Cabinet will only hold items that do not normally stack nicely, like Swords or other tools. It will also organize them alphabetically for you for easy retrieval!

quests.name: Basic Components
quests.description: To start with, I will show you how to make the simplest of components. You may know about some of these, but I'd like to explain them anyways so we're both on the same page. Assuming things leads to accidents, and I'd rather avoid the paperwork for such things, wouldn't you? Relax, that was a joke, but getting hurt isn't, so we'll go steady and make sure you have things down each step of the way, especially as the word is your entire world is infused with...magic? Well, we are not sure how it might effect things, my assistants are hopeful that it'll improve things in the long run. I'd like you to send me two samples of each component you make, so that we can make sure you have the idea down, and also to examine and research them ourselves.

tasks.longDescription: Shape four sections of stone into servicable gear teeth, and use sturdy wooden sticks to hold them together. Just one stick wouldn't work, but the four sticks can hold together and do more than just the sum of their parts.

A Capacitor stores energy and dissipates it at a constant rate. We'll use some very conductive metal, mainly Gold Nuggets, to create the two 'plates' that store the electrical charge between them. We'll use the Copper to create some small wire leads and coat both ends in Redstone so that the conductor stores Redstone Flux, or RF, energy for us. Why? Because a lot of RF engines don't have a....steady...output, and our machines need to be able to store a bit of RF like a battery in case the RF generators stop for any reason.

Most of the machines I will show you how to make all require a secure, sturdy housing. This provides a solid base for them, and gives them anchor points for any moving parts they may have. A frame made of solid Iron rods, with a thinner mesh of Iron Bars should work well.

Rubber is the standard material used in insulation, but isn't used as much when we also need to bind parts together. Most glue I know of isn't suited for the job: it either conducts electricity, which defeats the purpose, or melts when heated up. Thus, I use a material called Conduit Binder, which does as it says : binds things. By mixing some Clay with some Sand and Gravel in specific amounts, you get a Composite material you can then melt in a Furnace to get the Conduit Binder.

quests.name: The First Tier
quests.description: So now that you have shown me that you can make the basic components, lets advance to the first real stage of our lessons. I'll teach you how to make a power generator that will let you power the four other machines. With these machines, you'll be able to do a variety of things, including making somewhat more advanced materials. I'll warn you, things will start to get more complex as we get deeper into these lessons, but with the quality of the work you sent me? I have very little to worry about, you show a ton of promise, Bandit!

quests.name: The Long Grind
quests.description: To process various basic materials, we need to break them down a bit. This machine design is called a SAG Mill. You can grind many different things in it, but perhaps the most useful to you will be Ore. If you grind a chunk of, lets say, Iron Ore, the SAG Mill will sift out enough Iron Dust to melt down into two Iron Ingots, instead of only one, as when you melt an entire chuck of Iron Ore, you lose material burning away the impure Cobblestone. But, given how geological strata tends to be, the machine also has a chance of sifting out other useful materials. In the case of Iron Ore, it might find enough Tin Dust for you, or even enough Iron Dust for another Ingot. It may also have enough ground down stone for a useable chuck of Cobblestone. Two things, for sure, you will need for bigger machines, so I would like you to send us a few samples of them.

tasks.longDescription: You can upgrade the machine with a few different items. Bigger capacitors will give it a bigger internal Battery. There is also a spot for a Grinding Ball to increase efficiency. Flint is a good starting material to use as a Grinding Ball.

For this next material, I highly suggest wearing some gloves, and clothes you do not mind getting really dirty. Many of the alloys we use require a boost in temperature for a very short time, and to achieve that we use finely ground Coal. It is simple to obtain, just put some Coal in a SAG Mill.
Silicon is one supremely useful element. Most biological forms require it, even a tiny amount of it. We can easily obtain some by grinding Sand in the SAG Mill to sift it to a useable form.

quests.name: Simple Power Generation
quests.description: Most of the machines I will teach you how to make will require power to run. I'm not sure what kind of power generators you may or may not know yet, but I have a few designs that I know work well. The simplest of these is a Stirling engine. It will burn solid fuels, and use the heat and pressure to move cylinders inside the machine back and forth to generate energy. The Capacitor inside will act as a battery to store some of the RF energy it creates.

quests.name: Metal Mixing
quests.description: Iron, Copper, Tin, all of these are useful in various ways on their own. Iron is strong, Tin is easily shaped, Copper is a great conductor. But for more useful, powerful machines, we'll need better materials that still retain the different qualities these metals have. One of the best ways to do that is to mix the metals, or the metal with other materials, to create an Alloy. This new material will have various properties from all its base materials, and can even form stronger properties from various chemical or other interactions, or in your world's case, a little bit of Magic perhaps! Please send us samples of this list of Alloys I want you to make, I want to test them with these Magical components.

tasks.longDescription: Some things we will be making will require a metal that is both fairly conductive for RF Energy, but also strong. We can create an Alloy by smelting together Iron and Redstone Dust. This creates a fairly strong metal that can transfer Energy fairly efficiently.

Many of the machines we will be making require something a little bit stronger than Iron. Usually this means we need to refine Iron into Steel, both requiring Coal Powder for higher temps. Now, there are two main methods I use to refine Iron, and each one produces a different type of Steel. The first is using Silicon to help refine the Iron into Electrical grade Steel.
The second, much more recent discovery thanks to researchers here at The Business, is replacing the Silicon with Obsidian instead, which creates a Dark, much stronger Steel.
Many of these machines require special alloys for transmitting Energy in different ways. By heating up Redstone, we can then mix it with Silicon to get an Alloy highly conductive to RF transfer.

Two of my assistants have been collecting a bit of research data and presented it to me, and I'm confident we can make an even more Energetic based alloy. In what you call "The Nether" are glowing materials, similar in structure to Stone, but Glow quite brightly. If you take some Glowstone Dust and mix it with some molten Gold and some Redstone in the Alloy Smelter, the resulting Alloy should be full of potential energy.
We've found that we can melt Soul Sand down and mix it with molten Gold to form a new Alloy.

quests.name: Better Transparency
quests.description: Many times, just regular glass will not cut it when we need it in a machine. It either melts easily when we don't want it to, or it just isn't clear enough to suit our needs. With the Alloy Smelter, we can solve both of these issues quite easily. Clearer glass is easier to accomplish, but the stronger glass will require a bit of a jaunt to the Nether, I'm afraid to say. Please pass us some samples of these materials as well, as some of my assistants believe they are on the track of something new.

tasks.longDescription: When melted down, Quartz creates a structurally sound Glass that is good for higher temperature situations, or when working with UV Light, Telescopes, and many other things. The problem is it doesn't look like your 'base' world has enough Quartz in your sand to use....but your Nether has it in abundance.

A common method of making glass is melting down sand. The problem with this? There can be a wide variety of impurities in the sand, which show up in the Glass itself and make it imperfect. Little whorls, light shining through oddly, little scuffs deep in the glass. We can fix this quite simply by heating the sand in the Alloy Smelter, which can heat evenly for a much longer time than a normal Furnace, burning away impurities in the molten Glass and giving us something that is Quite Clear as a result.

quests.name: Higher Grade Components
quests.description: While I've been aiding you in learning how to make many of our useful machines, a few of my assistants have been tasked with researching these Pearls that the unique Endermen of your world drop. We believe they are the Endermen's eyes, and they seem to exhibit quite intriguing properties. The first few things they've discovered is that they work well in the Alloy Smelter, and we can create new Alloys with it. Along with a few other new materials unique to your world, we also have the second tier of Capacitor as a component you will need for the next machines. If you would, please send us samples of each, my assistants would appreciate the boost in research materials at hand.

tasks.longDescription: By combining two Basic Capacitors, housing them in Electrical Steel, using Coal Powder to help heat and bind everything together, you create a bigger Capacitor. You can also use it as an upgrade in a machine to increase its Energy Storage and Processing Speed.
When smelting an Ender Pearl with some Iron, we get a form of Iron that seems to pulsate, much like a steady heartbeat.
If we combine a Pearl with Energetic Alloy, we instead get something that seems to....glow with energy.

With some of these new materials we can now expand on the special Undead Logic processors...and include Endermen in our designs. It seems somewhat gruesome, but as one of my assistants puts it, "It isn't like they need their heads after you collect them." Also, you can keep these for now, scanning them is enough for us.

quests.name: Daylight Power
quests.description: When we speak about efficiency in Generator design, we cannot forget that we have one of the biggest Generators at our disposal : The Sun. Due to its distance, we can't exactly tap into the vast amounts of power the Sun generates every second, but we CAN harness it a bit. By coating Silicon with Energetic Alloy, hooking it up to a Daylight Sensor and creating a frame of Fused Quartz and Electrical Steel, we can create a Photovoltaic Cell. While one on its own doesn't generate much RF Power, you can place a lot of them for relatively cheaper materials. Best of all, they require no fuels on your part, but only work in the daytime, and when in clear view of the sky.

quests.name: Burning Water
quests.description: Now that we are able to distill Liquid Fuels for use, we need a new Generator to burn the fuel in. The Stirling Generator isn't quite able to burn liquid without melting itself, seeing as it doesn't have any way to hold either the Liquid Fuel or the Coolant required. By combining a stronger Electrical Steel and a few Reservoirs, we can create an internal chamber to burn the Fuel and keep it from getting too hot with some Water. Another way we can generate power, though, is by employing some of your world's Magic...by hooking up a Zombie Head to a similar construct as the Combustion Generator, by keeping the head alive with Nutrient Distillation, it will continue to generate power for you.

quests.name: Enlightened Transparency
quests.description: The Fused Quartz we made using your world's materials seems much stronger than the similar product we can make here. This got my assistants considering more possibilities with the material, so one of them attempted to mix powdered Glowstone into the molten quartz, and came out with a type of Fused Quartz that emits its own light! We then tried the same thing with Quite Clear Glass, and got quite similar results. Please provide my assistants some samples of both of these, we've got some interesting things in the works here.

quests.name: Improved Power Systems
quests.description: These new materials vastly increases our potential for generating Energry. Not only generating it, but storing it as well. We've come up with an improvement on that old Photovoltaic blueprint I showed you how to make earlier, and this new version should be quite superior. With this and your other Power generators, along with the use of Energy Conduits, its much easier to make large Power Generation setups to power your home, base, or whichever you have constructed to survive out there with. We've also come up with an expandable Energy Storage solution for you, and a way to monitor your Power Network to make sure everything is running fine. We also have something to wirelessly recharge items you are carrying that run off RF Energy.

tasks.longDescription: These Capacitor Banks can be placed and combined into larger and larger structures. The larger the Capacitor bank you've made, the more it stores and the higher its Input/Output is.

With you creating networks of Power Conduits, I think it would be a smart idea to create a Power Monitor. With it, you'll be able to see how much Energy your network is storing, how much is being used, and you can even have it send out a Redstone signal depending on how much Energy you have. This is an excellent way to turn on a set of Generators if, say, your power dropped below a certain point. Be sure to attatch the Monitor to your network by a Power Conduit, otherwise it won't be able to read the network.
This machine can recharge tools in your inventory up to twenty meters away.

quests.name: Enhanced Conduits
quests.description: Basic Conduits are good for smaller networks. They can pipe around enough for a handful of machines, a few faucets, etc. When you need to go bigger, though, you run into a few issues: not enough throughput, so not enough Energy or Liquid or whatnot will get to all the machinery you want. Time wasted is money wasted, right? So we have some more advanced Conduits you can make, and hopefully if my assistants finish their current projects, even better Conduits for you!

tasks.longDescription: Not only will it pump Fluid much faster, it will also negate the effect of Gravity on the piping fluid!

quests.name: Custom Conduits
quests.description: Being able to transport items like this is fantastic, but at the scale of operation The Ferret Business works at, we are always in need of improving logistics designs. Item Conduits are fantasic for transporting materials, especially in large quantities. We've come up with a good variety of ways to augment your Item Conduits, from speeding them up to filtering the items that pass through them. These upgrades can be added to the point where a Conduit connects to an Inventory.

tasks.longDescription: The simplest way to improve an Item Conduit is to speed it up. This upgrade will increase the number of items a Conduit can pull from an Inventory. Each conduit can accept up to 15 of these Upgrades.

Item Conduits are fantasic for transporting materials, especially in large quantities. Sometimes, though, we need to control what they take from or put into an inventory. With this, you can define up to five items, and the Conduit will only grab or put those items in that inventory.

The Basic Filter is good and all, but sometimes you need a bit more control over what the Conduit will and will not accept. You can filter up to double the number of items (10 of them, that is), and also filter items that match within the Dictionary, for such things as Ores that are more or less the same.

Filting specific items into a new inventory system is helpful, but what happens if you have an organised inventory system already set up, and want to sort like that? You can use the Existing Item Filter to take a Snapshot of the inventory's contents at the press of a button!

Specific Labs here at The Business have requested a way for them to more broadly define how we can filter items. This Upgrade can be set to accept only items from specific Modifications. You can choose up to three seperate Modification tags, and the Filter will only move items from those Mods.
This Filter enables you to sort by how much power an item has stored.

quests.name: Enderic Tools
quests.description: Since the discovery of the Vibrant and Pulsating Crystals, all of my assistants have been hard at work helping me to harness the power of Ender. We've created a pair of items that should be quite useful to you. The Magnet will simply be useful around your workshop, but I think the Staff will become quite useful with further research.

tasks.longDescription: The Electromagnet, when Powered and used, will draw items dropped on the ground towards you.

tasks.description: I Would Port A Thousand Miles
tasks.longDescription: Sneak + Right Clicking staff will recreate a controlled Endermen teleport, propelling you forward a short distance instantly.

quests.name: Improved Wandcraft
quests.description: Now that you have an Infusion Altar, you can vastly increase the power of both your Wands and the Foci you use with them.                     You are starting to get into more and more powerful Thaumaturgy, so you'll want your Wand to match. Your basic wands can only take you so far.                  I highly suggest improving the Stability of your Infusion Altar. Wiggle helped me set up a grid of Candles and Skulls underneath it, for example.                                   You can find all these researches on the Thaumaturgy tab.

tasks.longDescription: To improve the Wand Caps for our Wands, we're going to have to do a bit more than just shape them in an Arcane Worktable. You'll need to infuse some Aspects and materials with your Infusion Altar as well to get the most out of them.      Silver Wand Caps are very good at channeling the four Primal Aspects (Aer, Ignis, Aqua, Terra).       Thaumium Wand Caps are good at working with all types of Vis.

There are six researches off the Greatwood Wand Core you can outright pay Research Points for. Each of these specialized Wand Cores corresponds to one of the six core Aspects. These Cores hold more Vis than a Greatwood Wand.          They also each have a special property : If their Vis type ever drops below 10%, they will slowly generate more. For example, a Blazing Rod will renegerate Ignis, while an Icy Rod will regenerate Aqua.

Greatwood and specialized Wands are much better than that Iron and Wood thing you started with, yeah? Well, how about we go the next step up?                          Silverwood Trees have great magical properties, so turning their wood into a Wand is only logical. It will give you double the Vis capacity of a normal Greatwood Wand, which will open up the doors to bigger pieces of Thaumaturgy!

quests.name: Advanced Distillation
quests.description: Essentia Pipe networks are fickle, complicated beasts. I still don't quite understand them myself, but thats why I have my familiar Wiggle to help me. She's the one who helped get this research into the Thauminomicon in the first place!          There are plenty of advanced devices you can use in a Essentia network, and all of them, when used properly, are a great boon to any good Thaumaturge.

tasks.longDescription: Wiggle says using these special tubes can help make your network a bit more compact, and less prone to gumming up.                                The Filtered Essentia Tube can have a Jar Label marked with a specific Essentia attatched to it. It will act just like a labeled Warded Jar : Only Essentia of that type will pass through it.                               The Restriction tube will halve the 'suction' power of any jar or device thats drawing Essentia through it. This is good for setting a 'preferred' path if there are multiple devices creation suction.         The Directional Essentia Tube will only allow Essentia to travel in one direction.

In the Essentia Distillation research, you unlocked the ability to make an item that we haven't had a use for until now : The Alchemical Construct. By itself, it isn't very useful, but instead is a component in a few more advanced devices.

With Glass Phials, we can capture Essentia as a sort of gassy liquid, but only in amounts of 8. This is good if we're making something that requires a lot of one Essentia, or mass producing something. But if we want more precision...                                      The Essentia Crystalizer, when Essentia is piped into it, will slowly convert Essentia into small Crystals. Each Crystal is a single Essentia point, but it takes a while for each Crystal to form. You can place a Chest next to the Crystalizer and it will deposit the Crystal into it.

The Alchemical Centrifuge research gives you access to two advanced devices.                           The Alchemical Centrifuge will take 'liquid' Essentia fed into the bottom of it, and break it down into the Aspects that make it (So Centrifuging Lux would break down into Aer and Ignis for example). For each Essentia it breaks down, it will will only generate and keep one of the components, though it won't pipe it.                                           For that, you'll need the Essentia Buffer. This special pipe has very minor 'suction' power, but it can store up to 8 of any combination of Essentia. Pipes can connect to any side of it.

Unlocking the Automated Alchemy research will enable you to create the Alchemical Construct, a device that can take Essentia directly from a Pipe network and do Alchemy for you.                                        Place two Alchemical Constructs, one on top of another, on top of a Crucible. The Crucible needs to be heated as usual, but doesn't require water. Then take your Wand with 30 Ordo, 30 Aqua, and 15 Ignis, and Right Click on one of the Constructs. If successful, you'll transform it into the Alchemical Construct! Now just hook it up to your Essentia Pipe network.               Right Clicking it will open an interface. Place the Catalyst in the left slot to see what it makes in the right. The bar down below shows what Essentia is required, and in what order (going left to right). If the Catalyst makes the item you are looking for, click the right hand slot to activate the Construct.              Normally the Construct can only do a single Alchemy production at a time, but by making and attatching Mnemotic Matrixes to the sides of the Construct by Sneak + Right Clicking them onto the machine, you can increase the number it will make at once. Each Matrix increases the operations by 1.

The Void Jar acts like a normal Warded Jar, except when it's full, it doesn't stop trying to draw more Essentia. Any extra Essentia is, instead, destroyed.                          Before Wiggles helped with this Research, we used to have chests full of certain Aspects...it was kind of a mess.

Now, I'm pretty sure you've caught onto the slight...wariness...I've had when I start talking about Taint. That's because it's a very dangerous thing that can easily get out of control if you let it. I won't get too much into it yet, you aren't ready, but I will teach you a very special Alchemical recipe you'll need.              Around Silverwood Trees you may occasionally find these crystal like flowers. If you've tried to grab one, it usually falls apart...but if you use a pair of Shears on it, you can harvest it. This is the catalyst you'll need to make an Ethereal Bloom.
