This special flower can be planted near Tainted lands to reverse it's poisonous advance, and hold it at bay. It only works for a short distance, so you'll need a lot of them.                          If you are having problems finding a lot of Shimmerleaf to make Etheral Blooms, I do provide a supply of them in the Corporate Shop.

quests.name: The Basics of Artificing
quests.description: There are a handful of simple things you can make with some mundane materials and just a touch of magic.                                        Most of these items will be useful in one way or another to you, whether its a component of a much more Thaumaturgic nature, or simply a nice looking piece.                  As a bonus, many of these look very magical in nature! Very wizardly to have around, if just for the look of things!

tasks.longDescription: Arcane Stone Blocks are a basis for many magical constructs. The Stone is reinforced with a bit of magical fire and the strength of the earth.

The Item Grate is a good way to keep items from, say, falling into your Crucible. Or allow only items to fall through the floor in an area.                                           When placed, you can Right Click the grate to open or close it. If open, items dropped on the ground will slowly fall through it.

The Artifice tab has two researches connected to the Arcane Stone Block : The Paving Stone of Travel and Warding.             The Paving Stone of Travel increases the speed of anything that walks over it for a few seconds.                                       The Paving Stone of Warding creates a barrier that can prevent most creatures from crossing over it, other than you and any Assistants you may have. It isn't perfect, though, some creatures are smarter than they appear.

You can weave some enchanted fabric on the Arcane Worktable with a bit of Wool and String, infusing it with a bit of magic.                           This cloth can then be used to make a simple set of wizardly clothing, which will lower the cost of casting spells from your Wand.           You can also dye this clothing just as you would Leather Armor, by placing it and the dye in a crafting table.
There is a basic set of Baubles and accessories you can make, that will become quite useful later on.

The Artificing tab is not the only one with some basic Artifice devices. In the Golemancy tab, you can learn how to make the Hungry Chest.                                          The Hungry Chest is your first foray into animating creations in various ways. It will grab and store any items that drop near enough to touch it.

Have you scanned a Bone and a Bow with your Thaumometer? If not, do so! You'll find a research that some crafty if...slightly morbid... thaumaturge of old came up with.         The Bone Bow fires faster and hits harder than a regular bow. The arrows fired from it also travel farther.

quests.name: Alchemical Distillation
quests.description: Now that you know the basics of Alchemy, the next step is to refine how you use Essentia to minimize waste.                                          That was kind of a mouthful, wasn't it? To put it in simpler terms, right now you are just tossing normal items into the Crucible to get the Aspects you want, and this usually leaves a lot left over in your Crucible, which breaks down into Taint. Which isn't a good thing, honestly!                                       Using Arcane Alembics and Essentia Tubes, you can distill basic items in an Alchemical Furnace into pure Essentia. This way, you can utilize everything that makes up an item, instead of risking waking things from the Dungeon Dimension.                                     Oh yes, keep in mind that all these Researches are in the Alchemy tab of your Thauminomicon.

tasks.longDescription: First things first, you'll need the Alchemical Furnace. You can convert a Cauldron into a Crucible the same way as always, placing the Cauldron and tapping it with your Wand. Then just break with a Pick or something to pick it up.

I'm not sure if you've come across one yet, but like Greatwood Trees, you can find these special Silverwood Trees occasionally when exploring. Their trunk is a silvery-white color, and the leaves are a deep blue, and usually stand out fairly well! Silverwood harnesses magic very well, so be sure to collect as many logs as you can, as well as any Saplings to grow your own later!                       With a Silverwood Plank and some Gold, you can make a Vis Filter, which is a component for a few Distillation tools you'll need.

The Alchemical Furnace uses solid fuel to break down items into their basic elements in the form of a slurry. If you use Alumentum, it breaks down things faster.                The broken down slurry, though, needs to be distilled further by the use of Alchemical Alembics. By placing one on top of the Arcane Furnace (by Sneak + Right Clicking it on top), it will extract a single type of Essentia. You can stack more Alembics on top of that one, up to FIVE of them! This way, you can utilize ALL the Essentia from an item!                                         You can Right Click a wand on an Alembic to face the flat part of it towards you. Shift + Right Clicking will empty any Essentia contained in it.

Now that the Alembics have distilled Essentia, you need a way to contain it for use later.                The simplest way is to take a Glass Phial, which you make like a Glass Bottle but cap it with Clay, and Right Click it onto an Alembic if it has 8 or more Essentia when you look at it. A Glass Phial can only hold 8 Essentia at a time.                   Another way to store Essentia is to Pipe it. Essentia Tubes are a bit fiddly, but they are the best way to transport and fill various other containers and devices. A tube can only carry one Essence type at a time, and a badly constructed network can get gummed up.                                    You can combine a Tube and a Lever to make a Valve, which lets you control the Essentia traveling through it.                                     The Essentia Resonator can be Right Clicked onto a Tube or Essentia containing device to see what it contains and where the 'suction' is coming from thats drawing Essentia.

The most useful thing you can store Essentia in is a Warded Jar. It can be easily picked up and moved around, and it can hold a good amount. You can also Right Click a Glass Phial on one to bottle the Essentia (if it has at least 8, don't forget!).                               Oh yes, Wiggle wanted me to mention that you can also make Jar Labels. Right Click it on a Jar that contains Essentia to automatically mark it with that type. You can also combine a blank Jar Label with any Phial of Essentia to 'mark' it with that Essentia. Then you slap it on a Jar, and only that Essentia will ever go into it, even if its been emptied.                                        You can remove a label by Sneak + Right Clicking a Jar with an empty hand.

quests.name: Your Thaumic Materials
quests.description: You got a Wand. You got a magic book. Now you need some reagents!      Every world I've encountered has these basic magical materials in the ground.                                    Crystals are a core component to most Thaumcraft creations, as they harness the magical energies of the universe within them. There are six basic crystals you can find in the ground just by mining regularly.                                      There are also two other components you will need to find : Cinnbar Ore and Amber.

tasks.longDescription: The first four crystal types you will need are the Element crystals : Fire, Earth, Air, and Water. Each contains some magic and the corresponding element.
The two other crystal shards you will need to find are Order and Entropy, two opposites of the same fundamental force of the universe.

The final two resources you will need encompass Life in different ways.                                            Amber is fossilized tree sap, and commonly contains within it insects and other living things, trapped in time.                                Cinnabar Ore can be found about as commonly as any of the Crystal Shards. By smelting it, you turn it into Quicksilver, also known as Mercury, the embodiment of the ever changing, shifting thing called Life.

quests.name: Bigger Backpacks?
quests.description: Okay, I agree, sometimes a normal Backpack just isn't enough. Not enough space in the world to fit an entire long forgotten set of ruins in it, right? Well, I can't solve THAT problem, but you CAN make a much larger Backpack! You can bound up some Leather together with String, then 'cure' it in a Furnace, and use this Tanned Leather to make even larger backpacks!

tasks.longDescription: You can also make a Big version of the Workbench Backpack if you want!

quests.name: Dense Ores
quests.description: It looks like your world is rich in natural resources! Your coal and ore veins especially are rich! Some of them even have pockets of really dense material. How bout sharing the wealth, eh? Carefully cut out some Dense Coal Ore for me! You'll probably need a special Enchanted magical pick to do it though.

tasks.longDescription: Silk Touch allows you to harvest blocks unbroken, such as Ice.

quests.name: Exploring the Under World
quests.description: You know, I've explored something similar to your Nether. It might have been the same one! Or a bad fever dream from some questionable mushroom stew but...your QUEST Tablet scanner shows data that matches what I remember! So, let's just assume I had something like a spiritual quest at some point to help you! If you have trouble finding some of these things, an old shaman I had met in my adventures did show me how to make some of these things...

tasks.longDescription: Tainted Soil is special in that it can be lit on fire permanently, like Netherrack, but also has the nutrients required for Nether trees and plants to grow! Heat Sand will burn you if you aren't wearing footwear, but acts much like regular Sand. If you are having trouble finding either of this (The Nether IS a pretty big place...) you can craft some reasonable substitutes!
The Nether has its own set of berry bushes! Unlike the other ones, each berry here has its own special properties when eaten.

The Nether has its own range of special trees with unique looking woods. Be careful though, as many of them (like the fusewood) are dangerous to gather without taking precautions! Ghostwood saplings may or may not exist in the Nether, but if you can get some Ectoplasm from any Spirit escaping a monster after you kill it, you can turn any Sapling into a Ghostwood Tree.
The Nether is home to a lot of different funguses...fungi? Funguy? I don't know, but they make a really cool looking soup!

quests.name: Netheral Materials
quests.description: The Nether is home to a wide range of dark, dangerous beasties. Some of them don't want to bother you, but most are more than happy to try feasting on your noggin. Don't feel bad about repaying the favor, as these creatures can drop some quite useful materials for you.

tasks.longDescription: Imps are mischevious little creatures that aren't inherently hostile to you. Killing them nets you some Imp Leather, which you can use to make armor, and Raw Imphide, which is...kinda nasty to eat. You can cook it and it'll give you some positive effects, but it will also uh...poison you for a bit.
Heatscar Spiders are much more dangerous than their normal counterparts, and are ALWAYS angry. At you. They drop some useful string though.
The Imp Leather is quite useful in making some Fire Protection gear, which is quite helpful in the burning dangers of the Nether.
Many of the Nether materials can be used to make special tools and weapons. A special tool you can make is called the Kama, which carves through leaves especially well.

quests.name: Roguelike Dungeon n' MyWorldGen
quests.description: The heart of Adventuring is finding old, decrepit ruins that no one has touched in centuries and exploring them, finding lost artifacts in dusty tombs, dodging deadly traps and pitfalls, and just generally exploring the forgotten past for riches. Now, sometimes you gotta put your nose in a book, and I have...into my QUEST Tablet, and looked over some of the data from your world the eggheads here have sent to me. It looks like you have a LOT of very interesting structures in your world. Some of them resemble large, multilevel Dungeons full of perils and profits...while other things we've found, well...your world is really strange. I'm seeing stuff in the scanners I'd find down the street at the local bakery, or things in some of the novels I like listening to while traveling. It seems your world is some sorta nexus of lost, interesting ruins of past, present, and future! Find some intriguing things from these Dungeons and Ruins and send them to me. If I can get more people interested, they'd be more than willing to pay you top coin for more of them!

tasks.longDescription: You can find Laudanem fairly commonly inside any large Roguelike dungeon. You should also send 3 broken monster spawners : zombie, skeleton, and spider.

quests.name: Elegance in Flight
quests.description: So, we have Jetpacks and backpack batteries...why do we not have both? Well, usually because it takes enough just to keep a jetpack powered, let alone transfer power to your other armor and tools at the same time! But with with materials from EnderIO we can build the best Jetpack in existance!

tasks.longDescription: Start by creating an alloy out of a Pulsating Crystal, some Dark Steel, and Solarium in an EnderIO Alloy Furnace
Take Fused Quartz, surround it in Electrical Steel and Enriched Solarium Alloy to make the housing for a Flight Control Unit.
Take a Soul Vial and capture the Soul of a Bat, then use a Soul Binder to place it into the Flight Control Unit. Now you can make all the other sub-components with these materials for the Jetplate.

All jetpacks are worn on your chest. You'll have to turn on the jetpack with F (You will most likely have to rebind this to a different key). Double-tap jump to activate flight, then just land or double-tap to disable flight. You can also activate hover mode by hitting C, but this takes more energy when not on the ground. Hover Mode lets you decend slowly when not outright flying. You can activate Charging mode by hitting your Jetpack key while Sneaking.

quests.name: Warp Book
quests.description: So, some of the eggheads around here have been poking at the data on those strange Endermen. They've harnessed their strange teleporting powers into a simple book for our use. This should be quite useful for us as Adventurers, letting us zip home and back to freshly explored areas.

tasks.longDescription: Sneak + Right Clicking  will open up the book and let you place pages into it.
A page starts unbound. Right Click it to bind it to where you are currently standing. Place it into a Warp Book, otherwise when you use the bound Warp Page, you'll destroy the page when you teleport!

quests.name: Awaken the Power
quests.description: Now that we can summon Ender Dragons to fight when we want, and harvest their powerful Hearts of energy, we can further our Draconic research!                         I've compiled some new research notes on a Ritual that will imbue the power of a Dragon Heart into Charged Draconic Blocks, Awakening their power.                      Gather these materials and show them to me. I'm still compiling my notes into a book for you, for now consult the tablet from the Safety Match research.

tasks.longDescription: Such a strong creature has a very powerful heart.
To contain the power of the Awakening Ritual, you'll need to fully charge a Draconium Block.
Send me 4 Draconic Cores to show me you are prepared for the Ritual. I'll send them right back, along with a copy of the notebook.

quests.name: Botaniacal Soil
quests.description: [Gardener Greg]                             It seems Inventologist Irvine and Botonist Bitsy were talking, and they came up with some special soil you might be interested in.                 They've replaced the RF Energy components to the soil with Botania materials, so that you can grow these seeds with Mana instead. Just aim a Mana Spreader at the soil itself.

quests.name: Awakened Armor
quests.description: The strength and raw power of Awakened Draconium has plenty of uses, and easily the most useful for you would probably be to use it as armor, especially if you are looking to fight the Ender Dragons repeatedly.

quests.name: Intermediate Artificing
quests.description: Thaumaturges can make all manner of mundane and mystical objects. Some of them don't have an immediately obvious use, while others are infinitely valuable to the smart wizard.                            Here are some quite useful Artifices that should help you around the wizard tower... bunker... house? I'm not sure on what your living situation is on that world. Wiggle and I hope its comfortable, at least!

tasks.longDescription: The Primal Charm isn't very useful right now, but its good to know how to craft one for later. Though, I suggest keeping the Charm in your inventory for a while. Sometimes it can give you insight into new Research you can persue.

Stairs aren't very magical, and in a cramped wizard tower they can also be fairly dangerous.                 The Arcane Levitator research in the Artifice tab solves this problem in a very wizardly way! A single Levitator can lift you up about 10 blocks high. If you stack multiple, each one will increase the lift by another 10!                          To descend, Sneak instead and you'll be gently lowered.

A Thaumaturge's home is his castle. One with many important, and dangerous, creations! A good wizard has ways of keeping most everyone out. The Warded Arcana research gives you access to a good handful of items to help.            Warded Doors can only be opened or removed by the person who places them. To allow others access, though, you'll need to craft some Keys.                             Iron Keys can be Right Clicked onto a door you've placed to Bind it to that door. You can give this to an assistant, and he can use it on the same door to gain permanent access to it.                                  Gold Keys function the same way, but with one bonus : It grants the user the ability to make Iron Keys for that door as well. Only the actual owner of the door can bind Gold Keys to it, though.

The Arcane Pressure Plate can be configured to trigger in three ways : By everything (like a normal plate), by only you, or by everything BUT you.                         Arcane Keys can be used on them just like with Warded Doors. If you are using an Arcane Pressure Plate to open a Warded Door, the assistant needs to have access to both Door and Plate.                       Just like Warded Doors, only the person who placed them can remove them.
Just like Warded Doors and Arcane Pressure Plates, Warded Glass cannot be broken by anyone but the person who placed it.             Arcane Keys do not work on Warded Glass, though.

More than likely, you've scanned one of those strange Endermen or one of their Pearls with your Thaumometer. They seem to be of another world, don't they?                Just something to keep in mind. What? Oh, right! Another thing you can do with Glass is turn it into Mirrored Glass, by applying some Quicksilver to a Glass Pane. Not useful just yet, but it will be soon, trust me!

The Bone Bow was an improvement on a regular Bow, but its not the only thing you can improve.                                         By combining some normal Arrows with a Shard, you can make Elemental Arrows. Each Primal Element does something different.

quests.name: ADMINISTRATION - JOB TITLE
quests.description: [Message from Caigan]                          Please only use this quest if you need to regain Job Title Rank after a quest reset.

quests.name: Awakened Tools
quests.description: Awakened Draconium is a very powerful material, harnessing so much power from the Heart of a Dragon combined with a ton of RF Energy.                                        This means we can definitely use it to power up the designs of the Wyvern Tools we made before.

quests.name: Awakened Multitool
quests.description: Having a good set of tools on your belt is fantastic, but when you are battling Ender Dragons and other monsterous boss-like creatures, you need that belt space for other tools and items. Like healing potions, or building materials.                                     In consideration of that, we've come up with a very useful multitool for you, which combines the usefulness of a Pickaxe,  Shovel, and Sword into one single tool!

tasks.longDescription: To make this powerful Staff, we'll need the three base tools from you.

quests.name: Dark Research
quests.description: Now then, you may have noticed in your Thauminomicon, some Researches have this sort of...black cloud around them. This signifies that this knowledge is Forbidden.                                     To put it plainly, some things we Thaumaturges have learned was not meant for mortal minds. Eldritch knowledge, gleaned from the Elder Gods, the Dungeon Dimensions, and even further out. By learning these, we gain great power, but we also warp our minds just a little bit.      That is why the effect "Warp". Researching forbidden knowledge can gain you two types : normal Warp, and Permanent Warp. Normal warp slowly dissipates. You can guess what the other doesn't do.        The more Warp you have, the more chances you have of a Warp Effect taking place. At small amounts of Warp, it usually is just blurred vision, hearing things, etc. At higher amounts, you may see things...and given that you are a Thaumaturge, your mind can make it real.                                             There are many ways to mitigate these effects, to control them. As Wiggles says (since I showed her that blasted movie...) "With great power comes great responsibility."                               I need to teach you both about the Warp and about Taint. Please research the following :               [Basic Knowledge]                            Research Mastery                       Research Duplication                [Alchemy]                                      Alchemical Duplication                   Alchemical Manufacture                 Entropic Processing               [Artifice]                                       Infernal Furnace                        Sinister Lodestone

tasks.longDescription: In your Alchemy tab, off of Entropic Processing, are two pieces of Forbidden Knowledge involving Taint. Research them both before creating them, which will hopefully give you enough time to feel a minor Warp Effect.                  Bottled Taint is, more or less, a concentrated bottle of Tait. When used, you throw it like a Splash Potion, and it'll convert a small area to Tainted Land, where Taint will start to grow and spread.            Liquid Death is a fluid that really doesn't leave much to the imagination. Anything living or even pretending to be alive cannot survive in it. The upside of this dangerous substance, is that any creature that dies in it, the Essence they would normally drop crystalizes and can be retrieved.

Have you had a Warp Effect yet? No? Well, either way, there's a bit more research we can do while waiting.                                         You researched the Infernal Furnace in the Artifice tab, which is a large structure you can construct to smelt items without fuel. Unfortunately, it can be a bit slow. Fortunately, a new Research is available connected to it!              The Arcane Bellows can be attached to the side of the Infernal Furnace to both speed it up, and give you a chance at bonus items depending on what you smelt.      You can also attach the Arcane Bellows to Alchemical Furnaces to speed them up, or to normal Crucibles to get the water boiling faster.

Have you had a Warp Effect yet? You may not have noticed it yet, but your Thauminomicon would have! Check your Alchemy tab. In the upper left should be Purifying Bath Salts. If you don't see it, go ahead and do other things till you can Research it. You may need to do more Quests and Research to build up your Permanent Warp, so feel free to see what other tasks Wiggles and I have for you. Got it? Good!                                            Puryfing Bath Salts can help ease and lower the effects of Warp. You will need to make Salis Mundus by smelting a Balance Shard in any furnace, and use it as a Catalyst for an Alchemical recipe.     By creating a small pool of water and tossing the Bath Salts in, they will eventually dissolve, turning the water into a Puryfing Bath.                                            A note : Aurum Essentia is a bit hard to come by. The best place to find it is in Ethereal Essences, which can drop from magical Wisps, or more commonly by breaking an Aura Node with a pickaxe.

Purifying Bath Salts are great for cleaning the body, but you need something for the Mind as well.     By combining nine Magic Tallow into a Tallow Block and using it as a Catalyst, you can make Sanitizing Soap, which has a chance of removing Temporary Warp when used. The chance is greater when you are also under the effects of Purifying Bath Salts.

Dumping Water and Bath Salts into a hole each time you want to Purify yourself is a hassle. Why not make a Spa?                             The Arcane Spa, when filled with Water, will pump it into a 5x5 area above it. Adding Bath Salts to the Spa will automatically add it to the water as well.                                You can also have the Arcane Spa pump almost any liquid above it instead of Water.

quests.name: Fluxed Crystals 2
quests.description: [Gardener Greg]                              I got some fancy new seeds for you! They are fairly special, mind you, as they're a product of a few different labs here at The Business. One of em used to be the Magical Crops one, but their seeds were mutatin' weirdly and needed to go back to the drawing board.            Now, these seeds are a mite different. Instead of growing vegetables and grains, they'll grow goods for ya. Things like stone, sand, metal, and even gemstones!

tasks.longDescription: Now, first thing you'll need is some special soil. The Invent'n guy said that these seeds grow Crystals, and instead of normal water and compost, they only need RF Energy to grow.
Next, Irvine showed me what he called the Universal Seed. Seemed a bit strange, but it's like a blank piece of paper. Only in seed form. You'll understand in a bit.

The last thing you'll need to start with, is this little machine called a Seed Infuser. You can put that Universal Seed in here, along with the appropriate amount of materials, and Infuse them into a seed.                                           Irvine said to mention to you it's best to use NEI to find out whatcha can make. Whatever that means.

quests.name: Powered Production
quests.description: [Gardener Greg]                             Now then, ya can keep making cheap tools with those Rough Shards, or ya can actually make something useful out of them...like the actual resources!                     To do that, you'll have to clean up and refine those Shards through a couple stages to turn them into useful material. These two machines I'll show ya will actually require RF Energy, unlike the Infuser.

tasks.longDescription: The Gem Cutter will take yer Rough Shards, and with a bit of power, cut em down and smooth them out. This make sure the crystal shards are pure for the next step.

Those Smooth Shards can now be turned into resources. By putting a certain amount of Smooth Shards into the Refiner, it will turn it into a resource. How many Smooth Shards it requires depends on the material.

quests.name: MATERIAL - ROTTED BONE
quests.description: Material :  Rotted Bones               Amount :   20                       Targets : Skeletons, Zombies, and      other Undead Creatures           Bounty :   1 Bag of Coins

quests.name: A Beautiful Brew
quests.description: Brewing potions has been a pretty standard thing here at The Business for a while. Pick me ups, resistances, and more are quite useful in this very busy place. With so many things being rearched here at the Botanical Gardens, we wanted to see if we could improve on the classic Brewing system...and I think we definitely have! These Brews are a bit more potent than their classic counterparts, letting you drink from the same flask a few times to get the same effect.

tasks.longDescription: After placing your Botanical Brewer, you need to bind a Mana Spreader to it and supply it with Mana to Brew anything.

No matter the Brew, you need a vessel to hold it. Vials are made with Managlass and hold around four doses. To start a Brew, first add a Vial by dropping it onto the Brewer or Right Clicking the Vial onto it.
These Brews help you move around your world better, whether its making you move faster, jump higher, or breath under water.
These Brews aid vision, whether improving yours or making you invisible.
These Brews make you stronger and more resistant to damage.
These Brews help heal you.

Sharing knowledge with the Thaumaturgic research branch has lead us to discover a helpful Brew. Their more troublesome Research leads to being tainted with Warp, and enough of it can cause a loss of Sanity. This Brew helps you keep a clear and sane mind.
Overload gives you Strength, Speed, Weakness, and Hunger. Feather Feet makes you immune to falling to death. Marine Allure makes you a super Fisherman.

Crossed Souls will heal you a bit every time you kill something. Vanity's Emptiness will prevent mobs from spawning for 128 meters radius. Crimson Shade will remove all spawning restrictions in a 64 meter radius (monsters spawning in broad daylight, etc).

These potions are fantastic for quick pick-me-ups and short term help...but sometimes you don't feel like chugging a potion every few minutes if you are doing a long project in your workshop.                 This is where our new creation comes in! Many brews can be imbued into these fancy Incense Sticks. They'll last 60 times longer this way!                                             The downsides, though, is it'll take 10 times the Mana to brew these. You also can only burn them in the Incense Plate, which has a range of about 24 blocks. Use either a Flint and Steel or a Mana Burst through a Kindle Lens to ignite the Incense Plate.

quests.name: MATERIAL - SHIMMERING SCALES
quests.description: Material :  Shimmering Scale          Amount :   20                       Targets : Any fish or reptile       Bounty :   1 Bag of Coins

quests.name: MATERIAL - SLIME HEART
quests.description: Material :  Slime Heart             Amount :   20                       Targets : Gelatinous creatures       Bounty :   1 Bag of Coins

quests.name: MATERIAL - INSECTOID LEG
quests.description: Material :  Insectoid Leg             Amount :   20                       Targets : Any Insect or Spider       Bounty :   1 Bag of Coins

quests.name: MATERIAL - BROKEN TOOTH
quests.description: Material :  Broken Tooth         Amount :   20                       Targets : Any humanoid creature    Bounty :   1 Bag of Coins

quests.name: Ender Storage
quests.description: Your world has presented the whole of The Ferret Business with new things to research and examine, and the lab I'm from is no exception. Engineer Erin is very intrigued, I'm not sure if you've talked to him yet, but I myself have tinkered with some new Storage designs, and have come up with something fantastic. Using Blaze Rods to power some Ender Pearls, I've discovered a way to make containers that are able to connect to the same 'dimensional' area. By dyeing the three bars atop both containers to the same 'color key', they will both share the same inventory, no matter how far away they were from each other! Right click a dye on any of the three pips on top of the chest. When you break the chest, it will remember this key!

tasks.longDescription: Want more security? You can also Right Click a Diamond onto the latch to lock that Chest to you. If you had a Red-White-Blue chest, anyone with the same combination accesses that space. If you add a Diamond, it acts like a fourth combination with your name. Your Red-White-Blue Diamond'd chest will only access other chests you've locked with a Diamond. Anyone can OPEN your Diamond Locked chest, keep in mind, but it keeps someone from randomly cycling through colors to find waiting items.

quests.name: Pouch Perfect
quests.description: I love these Ender Chests. It makes supplying other parts of The Business much easier for everyone involved. The only problem? The Ender Chest is heavy and can only be opened when its set in place. Now, I had an idea. I'll admit, it was spawned after a session of Dungeons and Dragons, but I feel it IS pretty sound. Taking the same concept as the Ender Chest, except in portable Pouch form. Reach into the bag, pull out anything in one of the chests keyed to the same colors! Bam, modern Bag of Holding! Now, you'll need a chest set to the key you want first, you can't color this on the go unfortunately.

quests.name: Long Distance Liquid
quests.description: Solid items and container storage is fantastic, yet a lot of what we deal with is also liquid transport. Using the same concept as the Chest, I've come up with a liquid Tank that works just like it. The dial on the front has a blue side and an orange side. When blue is upward, it will accept liquids being pumped into it. When orange is up, it will pump liquid out on its own. The same color code on an Ender Tank won't connect to an Ender Chest, as that'd just silly. And quite messy.

tasks.longDescription: You can lock an Ender Tank just like you can an Ender Chest. You can also flip the dial remotely by sending a Redstone Signal to the tank. When the signal stops, the dial will flip back.

quests.name: The Factory Line
quests.description: You know, I think that it might benefit you if I got you in contact with a few specific engineers here....You being alone means you would benefit greately by utilizing some special mechanical machines! I think showing them some standard mechanical materials and supplies would catch their attention!

tasks.longDescription: Currently, only half of the quests in this questline are complete.

quests.name: An Aura of Power
quests.description: [[INCOMPLETE QUESTLINE]]                                                          You can submit materials to help this research branch for the future, and immediately gain access to its questline when it becomes available.

quests.name: Aura Cascade
quests.description: Hello? Hello are...oh, hi there! Um...not to disturb you and my Master's work but...I may have something new you may be interested in. Maybe?                       Um, who am I you ask? Well, you may notice the Master talk about his familiar a lot. That would be, well...me. My name is Wiggle, and the Master summoned me from another dimension to aid him. It was ah uh...very complicated magical contract, and I still have about twenty years of being his Familiar before the contract is up....                 I can tell you have some...um...questions. I'm not a slave, I can leave when I want, I just forfeit the rewards and power I'd get as part of the deal...

tasks.longDescription: To start off with well...you'll need to make some crystals. White Aura Crystals, actually, which will be the primary component in much of what we do.                                 Thank goodness they aren't too expensive...

What...oh! Right! I have my own powers and knowledge I'm willing to share with you. Like Thaumcraft, what I can teach you is fairly complex but...in a different way. Can...can you make this Encyclopedia? It'll fill with all the knowledge on its own, and it'll help both of us as I teach you.

quests.name: Tinkering With Tools
quests.description: [[INCOMPLETE QUESTLINE]]                                                          You can submit materials to help this research branch for the future, and immediately gain access to its questline when it becomes available.

quests.name: Heating Up
quests.description: [[INCOMPLETE QUESTLINE]]                                                          You can submit materials to help this research branch for the future, and immediately gain access to its questline when it becomes available.

quests.name: Secrets of Aura
quests.description: Hm, looking at the data from the Q.U.E.S.T. Tablet scanner, your world is definitely infused with a whole lot of untapped magic! If you can send me a few samples of some occult esoterica, I can pass them off to a sort of... eccentric wizard here.

quests.name: Thaumcraft
quests.description: Yes, yes, please, close the door behind you. All good? Phew! Take a seat, just push aside all that junk and...oh, right, you aren't really here. Well, if you have a seat handy over where you are, please, be seated for a moment.                         Sorry about the flowery language out there. There are apperances the mundane folk expect of us. My name is Wizard Watson, and I'm the head Thaumaturge here at The Ferret Business.                                      I hear your world is just ripe with untapped magical potential! Marvelous! Here, we have to keep a tighter control on magic, otherwise things'll get out of control by power hungry dolts.                          Your world is untapped, raw, and...empty. This will give us an amazing opportunity to teach you about the magic of Thaumcraft and further our own research as far as we can go, while we work on a way to get you home!

tasks.longDescription: Now then, to get started, you'll need a wand. You can make a pretty simple wand with some Iron and a Stick! Not very magical sounding now that you know, eh?                      Take some Iron Ingots and break them down into nuggets, and make a few Iron Wand Caps, then stick them on either end of a Stick. Whoosh, a Wand!

Now now, I know it seems a bit, well...mundane. A bit of metal on a stick does not a wand make, right? Well...hold on, where did I put it....          Merlin's beard I really need to clean this place some time. I had a spare book for you, but I can't seem to find it. Do you happen to have a Bookshelf near by? Just a regular one, nothing fancy! I can show you your first bit of magic!         Take that Iron Capped Wand, aim at that Bookshelf, and Right Click it!

Now that's what I call magic! What you have now is the Thauminomicon, your guide into the world of Thaumcraft. Inside its mystical pages is everything we Thaumaturges have learned, will learn, may learn, and more.                Look carefully through the book. There is so much for us to cover, but I know you'll do just fine. If you ever lose your Thauminomicon, just use any Wand on a normal Bookshelf to create another one, your new Thauminomicon will remember your progress.

quests.name: To Boldly Go
quests.description: [[INCOMPLETE QUESTLINE]]                                                          You can submit materials to help this research branch for the future, and immediately gain access to its questline when it becomes available.

quests.name: Bubble Bubble
quests.description: [[INCOMPLETE QUESTLINE]]                                                          You can submit materials to help this research branch for the future, and immediately gain access to its questline when it becomes available.

quests.name: Farm Machines
quests.description: [[INCOMPLETE QUESTLINE]]                                                          You can submit materials to help this research branch for the future, and immediately gain access to its questline when it becomes available.

quests.name: Fantastic Fauna
quests.description: [[INCOMPLETE QUESTLINE]]                                                          You can submit materials to help this research branch for the future, and immediately gain access to its questline when it becomes available.

quests.name: Knick Knacks
quests.description: [[INCOMPLETE QUESTLINE]]                                                          You can submit materials to help this research branch for the future, and immediately gain access to its questline when it becomes available.

quests.name: Helpful Devices
quests.description: Our further research into Draconium and dragons in general has come up with a bunch more helpful devices you might like!             The Advanced Player Detector is an improved version of the Player Detector. 20 block range, lets you camoflauge it, and has an Inverted Redstone Signal mode to save you wiring space! It also has a white/blacklist so you can add your trusted assistants to it and not have them set up off some sort of protective failsafe!                      Then we have the Disenchanter. You can take a magical item and place it in the left slot, an empty book in the center slot, and hit the Transfer button and voila, the top listed enchant has been moved to the book! Careful, as this damages the magical item! You can cut down or outright prevent the damage by surrounding the Disenchanting table with bookshelves.                     Last but not least is the Draconic Chest. It bends space and time so has a giant inventory, as well as a crafting bench inside that. On top of that, it also has a furnace inside of it, which will double Ores smelted inside it. You can hold the chest and Shift + Right Click to change its color before setting it down.

quests.name: Crystal Network
quests.description: Now that you are working with massive amounts of power, we wnated to figure out a way to distribute it in a large area without using cables or conduits, since those take up a lot of room.               What we've come up with is a network based on Crystals, transmitting the RF Energy wirelessly between them. Each crystal has a range and a maximum number of other crystals they can connect to, so you'll need to chain crystals together to go farther distances.                                      The primary tool you use to bind crystals together into a network is the Crystal Binder. It has multiple modes you can switch between by Shift + Right Clicking it. As long as you are holding the Crystal Binder, you can see all the connections between nearby Crystals.

tasks.longDescription: You can switch modes by holding the Crystal Binder and doing Shift + Right Click.

The basic crystal is the Relay. It cannot send or receive energy from a block, its whole purpose is to connect Crystals in the network. You'll primarily use it to go further distances or as a connection hub.        Range : 25                                 Max Connections : 10

The Tranceiver is the crystal you'll use to give or take RF Energy from a block. Place it on the side of any RF machine or otherwise, and Bind the crystal to the network. Then change your Crystal Binder to Mode Change and use it on the Tranceiver to switch it between Input and Output mode.        Range : 25                                 Max Connections : 2
The Energy Relay and Tranceivers have Advanced versions you can craft. These double the range and number of connections they can have.

The Wireless Tranceiver enables you to cut down not only on cables, but on using many Crystals in your energy net. You do not need to hook a Tranceiver up to the side of a block anymore to transfer energy to and from it.       To bind a machine to the Energy Net, first use the Crystal Binder in Bind Mode on the Wireless Tranceiver, then on the machine.          Range : 25                                 Wireless Range : 15                      Max Connections : 3                     Max Wireless Connections : 8          As before, the Advanced Version will double all of these limits.

quests.name: Initial Signal
quests.description: So we've been testing some things with Draconium, looking to further our research. We've found lots of great things already, but also come across some small, relatively cheap devices that could help you.                                       First up, a Potentiometer, which can emit a variable strength Redstone Signal between 0 and 15.       Then we have the Rain Sensor, which will emit a Redstone Signal when its, well...raining of course.          Last we have the Player Detector, which will emit a Redstone Signal when you or another assistant gets within about 10 blocks.

tasks.longDescription: These are some fairly cheap items to make, especially when you consider how much the rest of this research is.

quests.name: Round the World
quests.description: The power of Awakened Draconium, when combined with the very essence of Dragons themselves, enable us to make a very special device. One that  can control time itself!                           The Sun Dial, when a Redstone Signal is applied to it, will charge up, and then fire into the sky. Time will then fast forward, not stopping until you stop the Redstone Signal.       This will only affect the placement of the sun itself, it will not fast forward time for your crops or machines.

tasks.longDescription: This item requires us to obtain some...quite dangerous materials from Ender Dragons. Materials that are super fragile as well. Thus, the cost is...a bit extreme.

quests.name: Quite Accessable
quests.description: Now, it wouldn't be much of a home if we couldn't get into it, now would it? Nor would it be stylish if we couldn't make these things match current trends either! Just like Carpenter's Blocks, Slopes, Stairs, etc, you can place Covers on these to customize them!

tasks.longDescription: Left or Right Click a door with your Carpenter's Hammer to cycle through the different door styles. You can also Sneak + Right Click to switch between Wood and Iron Door behaviour. If you switch to Iron Door behaviour, it will require a Redstone Signal to open.

A Garage Door needs to be placed underneath a solid block, where it will then extend down to the floor. If you open a Garage Door and there are other Garage Doors  next to it, all of them will open at the same time.
Just like the Carpenter's Door, Right or Left Click with a Carpenter's Hammer to cycle styles.
Like Carpenter's Barriers, Right Click with a Carpenter's Hammer to cycle styles, or Sneak + Right Click the normal gate style to change its plank depth.

Left Click on the Carpenter's Pressure Plate with a Carpenter's Hammer to switch Redstone polarity (whether it emits a signal when something IS or ISN'T on it). Right Click with the Hammer to change what triggers the Pressure Plate: either players, animals, monsters, or everything. The pressure plate can also be placed on any side of a block.
Left Click either of these with your Carpenter's Hammer to switch the polarity of the Redstone Signal. You can place either of these on any side of a block as well.

quests.name: Quite Homey
quests.description: Nothing makes a house a home more than decorating it to your own style. Your own bed, a pretty flower in a beautiful flowerpot, wall to wall eye catching designs, there are plenty of ways to give something your personal touch. Did you know you can also add Dyes to most Carpenter's Blocks as well? Take normal Vanilla Dye powder, and Sneak + Right Click the Dye onto the Carpenter's Block. Sneak + Left Click with a Carpenter's Hammer to get the Dye back.

tasks.longDescription: Cycle between Torch styles by Right Clicking with a Carpenter's Hammer. The uncovered style will randomly extinguish if it is out in the rain. You can either relight it with another torch, or wait until the rain stops and it will reignite itself.

Left Click with a Carpenter's Hammer to change Redstone Polarity. Right Click to change when the Sensor will trigger: Player Sleep (when it gets dark enough to sleep or light enough to wake), Monster Spawn (When the light enters or exits the level where monsters would spawn), or Sun Exposure (Redstone output depending on orientation of the sun compared to the orientation of the Sensor). You can place the Sensor on the side of a block, but it will be less sensitive to the light.

You can plant most things in the Carpenter's Flower Pot. Right Click inside the pot to place soil, then Right Click a seed on the Pot to plant it. You can Sneak + Right Click the plant to remove it, then the Soil to remove it as well. You can Sneak + Right Click to remove the Cover. Left or Right Click the Pot with a Carpenter's Hammer to cycle through designs (You cannot have both a Design and a Cover). You can also Fertilize some plants with Bone Meal, where they will take on a lively green color.

To Dye the frame of the bed, apply it to the Head of the Bed. To Dye the Blanket, apply it to the Foot of the Bed. If just coloring the Blanket isn't enough, Left or Right Click on it with a Carpenter's Hammer to cycle through some designs!

You can remove a tile by Sneak + Left Clicking them with a Carpenter's Hammer. Left or Right click them normally with the Hammer to cycle through designs, then Sneak + Right Click them to rotate the design. Unlike other Carpenter's Blocks, Dyes used on Tiles will not be consumed.

With your Carpenter's Hammer, Right Click a safe to set whether Pipes or similar Item Transport methods can extract or input items. Sneak + Right Click to Lock or Unlock the safe. When locked, the light on the front turns Red, and only you and server operators will be able to open or break the safe. The blue light strip designates what percentage of slots are used. You can upgrade the capacity by holding a Gold Ingot, an Emerald, or a Diamond and Sneak + Right Clicking the safe.

quests.name: Redeem Thaumium Chit
quests.description: Fulfilling Contracts succesfully earns you Trader Chits. By combining two of the same value, you get a larger chit.                 The larger the chit you redeem, the more value it has. Four Bronze[8] chits are worth less than a single Silver[32] chit. Four Silver[32] chits are worth less than a single Thaumium[128] chit, and so on.

quests.name: Redeem Diamond Chit
quests.description: Fulfilling Contracts succesfully earns you Trader Chits. By combining two of the same value, you get a larger chit.                 The larger the chit you redeem, the more value it has. Four Bronze[8] chits are worth less than a single Silver[32] chit. Four Silver[32] chits are worth less than a single Thaumium[128] chit, and so on.

quests.name: Bones of Dragons
quests.description: The initial idea for my train of research was some of the data I gathered from your world. Specifically, the place you call The End is (or was?) home to a creature of legend : a Dragon. If it exists in your world, surely it exists in others?                            Sure, we have two legged dragons walking about The Business sometimes (they are especially insightful into magical research), but they are nothing like their ancient, mythical ancestors.                                    My research thus far has unconvered what the ancient people called The Bones of Dragons : a mystical metal that is some of the strongest, most magical we've ever seen.                              Thanks to some fairly dangerous research, my team is able to create this metal. Only in tiny batches, and with very expensive ingredients, but we've stockpiled enough to start selling it to you. Both to help us with costs, and to have you utilize it for more research.

tasks.longDescription: There are a few things you can do with Draconium, but my suggestion? Make some Tinker's Tools with it, you won't be disappointed!

quests.name: DecoCraft
quests.description: There are a lot of things that make a house a home, or a workplace a business, or a lab a laboratory. To me, its the little touches that matter. A kid's room doesn't seem fun without some stuffed animals, nor does a lab look scientific without some beakers, right? Well, you can make all these little accroutements from a simple material called Crafting Clay!

tasks.longDescription: A little Sand, a little Dirt, and some Green, Red, or Blue dye is all you need! Even Monsters seem to love it, it can drop from many different creatures!

Now that you have some materials to work with, you can work them in a normal Crafting Bench, or you can make yourself a DecoBench!                                     The DecoBench can be filled with large amounts Red, Blue, and Green Crafting Clay, or even filled with the basic Clay and dye. You can then easily search and craft any of the hundreds of Decocraft items!

quests.name: A House a Home
quests.description: Nothing makes you feel more at home than being in a house full of things you love, be it people, possessions, or both!

quests.name: Tier 2 - Burning Bullets
quests.description: Now, if you don't want to spend most of your time cranking the wind up Jack in the Gunbox, you'll want to upgrade your firepower pretty quick. Every higher tier base can be connected to RF Energy pipes of any sort, such as Ducts or Conduits. You can also pipe in ammo this way as well.

tasks.longDescription: Upgrading the Sensor allows better targetting, and using better materials provides more power. With the improvement of materials, we'll also need to make IO Busses.
Did you know, you can deactivate your Turret by applying a Redstone Signal?
The Machine Gun Turret will only fire Bullets. What it lacks for in single shot damage it makes up for by sheer volume.
The Incendiary Turret will fire Burning Clay, which explodes when it hits and lights things on fire. Be careful!

quests.name: Upgrades? Upgrades!
quests.description: [Gardener Greg]                             Along with all the designs and instructions Inventologist Irvine gave me, he also had a box marked Upgrades with it.                             Now, I'm not quite sure what some of these do. I've done testing and some are pretty simple to figure out, but Irvine sort of forgot to include instructions on how many of these work...                  The Refiner and the Cutter can have four upgrades in each of them. The Powered Soil can have upgrades as well, just Right Click one onto the soil. Each Soil can have up to three upgrades, and you can remove them by Shift + Right Clicking the soil with an empty hand.

tasks.longDescription: The Speed Upgrade makes both machines and powered soil work faster.                                         The Efficiency Upgrade will lower how much RF Power (or Mana) is required by either soil or machine.
Now, this upgrade had a label, but it ain't quite clear on how it works. Maybe ya can figure em out?

quests.name: Power Provider - Tier 1
quests.description: RF Energy is the basis for most of the power and electricity we supply clients with. Since we live in an electrical, industrial age, we are always selling gigawatts worth of power on a daily basis.                    Since we are always in need of more RF Energy to sell, I can offer you some coins in return. You'll have to use a specific storage medium, though : Ferret Batteries. You can easily make one with some Gold, Glass, Redstone, and the special metal alloy found in our Silver Coins. You won't be able to use them like normal batteries, though!                                         Place an Empty one into an EnderIO SAG Mill to start charging it to the first Tier. It will require 1 Miilion RF. You can then put the new Tier of battery back into the Alloy Smelter to charge it to the next tier, but be warned, each one is more and more expensive!                  For a Tier 1 battery, we'll give you a single coin. It doesn't seem like much, but RF Energy is pretty easy to generate, and you can quite easily automate it as well.

tasks.longDescription: Remember, to go from an Empty Ferret Battery to a Tier 1 requires a 1 Million RF.

quests.name: Thematic Deco Supply - Cheap
quests.description: Is it Christmas? Halloween? Do you have a spooky house or a historical recreation to decorate for? Thematic Decorations fit the bill for all sorts of holidays and occasions!

tasks.longDescription: To fill a Cheap Thematic Deco Crate, you will need to combine any 8 Cheap Thematic Decorations and an Unfilled Shipping Crate.

quests.name: Mass Supply - Sushi
quests.description: This will be the initial test of the Mass Supply system, to verify the profibility.                                     The task is simple : provide 1,000 Sushi. This will test both our refridgeration storage methods, and your mass produce production methods.

tasks.longDescription: Yes, this system test was created and approved by the CEO. Why do you ask?

quests.name: Mass Supply System
quests.description: We have a new level of contract we're exploring with our Traders, especially ones with access to their own factories. You...with all your space, you can easily build your own factory. It'd be a good way to get more coins, that's for sure, and give you something to do while the eggheads around here try to get you home.                        This system utilizes the Quest Delivery System, or QDS. You can pipe items into it to teleport to us, but you will need to select the Mass Supply quest first and bind it to the QDS.                                        It is also important to note : any items sent through the QDS get added to our inventory system. Do not send items through it you want back.

tasks.longDescription: After placing the QDS down, you will need to choose which Mass Supply you want to fulfill in your QUEST Tablet, and hit the "Select Task" button. You can then Right Click the QUEST Tablet onto the QDS, and it will be bound to that quest.         If the QDS does not show a mushroom on it, it is not bound to any quest!

quests.name: Mass Supply - Surv. Generator
quests.description: This will be the initial test of the Mass Supply system, to verify the profibility.                                     The task is simple : provide 1,000 Survivalist Generators. This will test your multi-step factory abilities and our storage and distribution methods for these products on this scale.

tasks.longDescription: We are planning on sending these generators as part of ferritarium aid projects across the world, here.

quests.name: Cheap Furniture Crate x25
quests.description: This Contract is for 25 Cheap Furniture Supply Crates.

quests.name: Mass Supply - Armor Stands
quests.description: This will be the initial test of the Mass Supply system, to verify the profibility.                                     The task is simple : provide 1,000 Armor Stands. This will test our odd item shape storage abilities.

tasks.longDescription: Only a fraction of these armor stands are used for their primary function : displaying armor.                Some roboticists here have instead been wiring them up and getting them to move! How weird!

quests.name: A Core of Power
quests.description: We need a good way to harness the strength and power of Draconium. One of my researchers suggested that we could shape the metal into a mystical symbol, like a medal.                                           The mystical nature of the shape helps to contain the power into what we are calling a basic Draconium Core.

tasks.longDescription: There isn't much you can do with a basic Draconic Core, but if you combine four of them with a Nether Star, you get a much more poweful item we call a Wyvern Core.             Both of these are key components in Energy Cores, which will be needed for further research.

quests.name: Advanced Wandcraft
quests.description: We can do much with just a couple Wand Caps and a Wand Core already, but sometimes even that isn't enough for a powerful Thaumaturge!                                 A grand wizard can make and use more than small Wands. There are various other magic channeling items, whether its a Staff, an Amulet, or even greater things! Not even the sky is the limit.

tasks.longDescription: One improvement we can make to Wands is an idea we Thaumaturges got from the electrical branches of the Ferret Business. Or did they get the idea from us? Either way, I'm talking about a portable energy storage!                                       No no, not a battery. Well, not exactly! It's actually an Amulet that you wear around your neck! You charge it in a Wand Recharge Station first. Then, while out in the field, just hold out your Wand and it'll slowly recharge from the Amulet.

Sometimes, you just don't need to be able to use a Foci with your Wand most of the time. If that's the case, you can sacrifice the Foci spot for some extra storage and power from the Wand itself!                By replacing the top with a Primal Charm and capping it with two Wand Caps instead of one, you can make a Scepter instead of a Wand. Not only does it give you a decent Vis usage discount, it also gives you 50% more Vis storage than the Wand Core usually has.                     Wiggles suggests that if you're going to make a powerful Scepter, make it Powerful with a capital P. Use Thaumium Wand Caps and a Silverwood Core, please.

Wands are great for compact magical workings, but sometimes you want something bigger!                      You can combine two Greatwood Wand Cores and a Primal Charm into a Greatwood Staff Core. Then add Wand Caps to the end like a normal Wand, and you got a big Wand...I mean Staff! Wiggles stop giggling....       Anyways! A Greatwood Staff has more than double the Vis storage of a Greatwood Wand. The downside is you cannot use it in an Arcane Workbench or similar.
Just like with Greatwood Wands, you can make specialized Staves as well, each one better at channeling a specific type of Vis.
Oh, and the bonus of using a Staff over a Wand? In a pinch, you can use it to club something over the head that's giving you trouble!

Another thing you can research is the Vis Charge Relay. By placing it on top of your Arcane Workbench, it can draw C-Vis from the network to recharge the Wand in the Workbench.                           Do note this is a lot slower than just picking up the Wand and tossing it into a Recharge Pedestal directly.

quests.name: Redeem Awakened Draconium Chit
quests.description: Fulfilling Contracts succesfully earns you Trader Chits. By combining two of the same value, you get a larger chit.                 The larger the chit you redeem, the more value it has. Four Bronze[8] chits are worth less than a single Silver[32] chit. Four Silver[32] chits are worth less than a single Thaumium[128] chit, and so on.

tasks.longDescription: A task where the player can hand in items or fluids. One can also use the Quest Delivery System to submit items and fluids.

quests.name: Better Spacial Anomolies
quests.description: Given the research into these Endermen of yours, one of my assistants has helped come up with a way to link two Better Barrels to the same dimensional storage space. We've decided to call it...B-Space. For Barrel. Kind of like L-Space (if you've heard of it), except with less uh....dangers.

tasks.longDescription: To apply the BSpace Upgrade to a Barrel, it must be empty.

To link two Barrels together, they must :                                   1) Be Empty                               2) Have BSpace Upgrades             3) Have the same Structural Upgrade                                       You can then Sneak + Right Click the Tuning Fork onto each Barrel to link them together.

quests.name: Better Better Better!
quests.description: Upgrading your Barrels doesn't stop with just 567 extra stacks of material. With these Structural and Storage upgrades, you condense quite a lot of something into a tiny, portable space!

tasks.longDescription: Each of these Structural upgrades adds 31, 63, and 127 additional Slots to a Barrel, respectively.
Each of these Storage upgrades adds 1,728 or 5184 stacks of Storage Space, respectively.

quests.name: THE FERRET BUSINESS
quests.description: This guidebook will help you understand the basics of the modpack and give you a handy changelog. You can get a new copy every few Minecraft days.

tasks.longDescription: PLEASE NOTE : THIS BOOK WILL BE UPDATED EVERY SINGLE VERSION!

quests.name: Thematic Deco Supply - Decent
quests.description: Stronger materials make items that last multiple seasons.

tasks.longDescription: To fill a Decent Thematic Deco Crate, you will need to combine any 4 Decent Thematic Decorations and an Unfilled Shipping Crate.

quests.name: Improved Farming
quests.description: Growing plants and animals the traditional way has worked for thousands of years, but this is the age of technology. Well, and magic, in your current world. So, to move with the times, we need to improve on older practices!

tasks.longDescription: Fertile Soil is tilled farmland that is rich in nutrients and does not need to be watered.
The Veterinary Station applies Syringes to a 5x5 area in front of it.
Health Syringes will heal creatures, while Slime Embiggening Syringes do what it says on the tin, more or less : using one on a Slime will cause it to grow larger.

Growth Syringes will instantly grow Baby animals into Adult animals. It is kind of expensive, so you can use a Zombie Syringe instead to do the same thing, but it DOES kind of have a...slight...chance of turning them into a Zombie instead.
Villagers in your world seem to be very prone to zombie attacks and zombification. Using one of these Syringes on them will turn them back, though!

quests.name: Auto Magika
quests.description: The magical nature of your world gives everyone here at The Business amazing, wonderful ideas. We all have so much to research and experiment with! I have a few enchanting things that should be of great use, and will definitely broaden the types of factories we can make!

tasks.longDescription: Records from your world are...fairly mysterious. They are old school vinyl style, but have lots of potential. This Auto Jukebox can automatically play any Record piped into it. A Redstone Pulse will turn it on or off. If you supply it with a Blank Record as well, it can make a copy.

This machine will extract a random Enchantment from any enchanted item you insert into it, placing it into a Book. It requires a Book and a bit of power to do this. Careful, as this can damage the original item.
If you need more items to Disenchant, you can use the Auto Enchanter. Supply it with some Essence and things to Enchant, it will automatically Enchant them up to level 30.

quests.name: RedNet Tools
quests.description: RedNet Cables and the Programmable Rednet Controller vastly improve the types of circuits you can make...and also vastly increases the steps you can mess up! To that, I have a bunch of tools you may be interested in when dealing with RedNet Cables, as well as a bonus machine that can only be fully utilized by a Programmable RedNet Controller!

tasks.longDescription: The RedNet Meter displays information when used on RedNet Cables, like Signal Strength. The RedNet Multimeter, though, is used on RedNet Energy Cables, and can also display things like power.
Can be connected to RedNet Cables to display the strength of a Redstone Signal that passes through it as a function of time.

Noteblocks made of your magic materials are very odd. They only make sounds depending on the material they are on...but we can control this function with a RedNote Block! What note it plays can be controlled by what Strength a Redstone Signal is that hits it. It is also the only machine I know of that can detect Signal Strength above 15, which can only be obtained via a Programmable RedNet Controller and RedNet Cables.

quests.name: A Little Fun
quests.description: Hey, did you ever make a Potato Cannon when you were a kid? You know, some PVC pipe, an end cap, an igniter, a bit of hairspray, and a properly sized spud?                       What, really?! Well, you can make one now as well! The bonus is you don't really need hairspray, with your magical materials. Or a lighter. And the potatos might hurt a little more than before...

quests.name: The Power of Infusion
quests.description: Alchemical creations and Arcane Worktable constructions can only harness so much magical potential. For the big, fun stuff, we're going to have to get into Infusion Rituals.     The start of this research can be found on the Artifice tab of your Thauminomicon. Just a fair warning : This is a very involved process. It will require using your Alchemical Distillation techhniques, and can be very dangerous if not done correctly. I'll do my best to explain things, but you should always read your Thauminomicon closely!

tasks.longDescription: You'll want a large, open area for this. I mean big, at least 10x10 if not larger. Also, be sure its in a safe location, because failure can be... catastrophic. Just a fair warning!                                        You will need 4 Arcane Stone Blocks, 4 Arcane Stone Bricks, an Arcane Pedestal, and a Runic Matrix. Just to make things easier, make a total of 9 Arcane Pedestals, as you'll need them.                        Follow the layout in your Thauminomicon. Keep in mind, there is an empty space between the center Pedestal and the Runic Matrix above it. When ready, Right Click your Wand on the Matrix (if it has enough Vis of all the Aspects!) to construct the Infusion Altar. It should very obviously change.

Now, as I said, Infusion is powerful and dangerous. Before we do the first infusion, we should reduce what is called Instability. The more powerful an item you are infusing, the more Instability it has when doing the Infusion Ritual.           You can reduce Instability by placing certain magical objects around the Infusion Altar. Candles, Skulls, and Crystals are the most common.                                         Any item you place needs to be counterbalanced on the opposite side. If you place a Candle three blocks North of the center, place another one three blocks South. For even more stabilty, place two more to the East and West as well!       To start, I suggest gathering four White Tallow Candles, two Zombie Heads, and two Skeleton Skulls. Along with the other eight Arcane Pedestals I had you make, you should be able to add a bit of stability to your future Infusions.       Be sure to consult the Thauminomicon page on the Infusion Altar!

As you can see, you now have a whole lot of new Researches branching off the Infusion one. For introduction, we'll make something I feel will be quite useful and stylish where you are : Boots of the Traveler. Go ahead and research it, and start gathering the components.                                   The shards, fish, Enchanted Cloth, Leather Boots, and Feather are simple to gather. The more difficult part is gathering the Iter and Volatus Essentia. I highly suggest you take a peak at a simple Boat and some chicken Feathers.         When you have the Essentia needed in Warded Jars, go over to your Infusion Altar. Place the Leather Boots in the center Pedestal, then the other components on the Pedestals on the outside. You need to keep a balance of items : an item placed on a North pedestal needs to have an item placed on a South pedestal. If there are an odd number of items, then one item will have an empty pedestal opposite it.                         Make sure each item is placed correctly, then place the Warded Jars within 10 blocks of the Altar. When everything is in place, Right Click your Wand on the Runic Matrix.    Watch the Infusion carefully. If an item pops off its Pedestal instead of getting absorbed, quickly put it back on!

quests.name: The Basics of Wand Usage
quests.description: Your studies are progressing nicely I have to say! Now what is next...hmm...Wiggle! Wiggle where are you?                                              Oh bother, I sent Wiggle out a while ago to find a book for me. Hm? Oh, sorry! Wiggle is my familiar. She's a real help around here. Now...hm...Oh, I know! I should teach you the basics of Artificing and Vis Collecting.                                      You may have noticed when wandering around with your Thaumometer, some very bright points hovering around the world. Did you scan one yet? You should! These are called Aura Nodes, and they contain energy called Vis. Vis usually comes in the 6 base elements, but sometimes you'll find a node with a compound element!            Be sure to scan every node you find, your Thamic Knowledge will remember their locations for use when you've advanced a little bit.        Oh, right, do you have Copper Wand Caps researched yet? Please do, its in the Thaumaturgy tab of your Thauminomicon!

tasks.longDescription: The first thing you'll need to do is go find some Aura Nodes. Hold your Wand and hold Right Click on them to start absorbing the Vis from it. Your starting wand can't hold much, but try to fill all the aspects you can. You can also collect them from killing monsters.       Build yourself another Thaumcraft Table and set it down close to your Research Table, then Right Click your Wand onto it. This will turn it into an Arcane Workbench!                                    You can now craft magical items, using the stored Vis in the Wand. Make yourself some Copper Wand Caps please!

Now that you have an Arcane Worktable, you can make another fairly nifty item that should help in early research. In the Basic Information tab, you should see a new research brancing from Research Expertise called Deconstruction Table. Go ahead and complete the research and make it.     This special Table will break down objects to their base Aspects, converting them into Research Points for your Research Table. It's only a small chance to get Research Points, but the more Aspects an item contains, the bigger the chance.

See, just holding a Thaumometer all the time when searching for Aura Nodes isn't very fun. It's also dangerous!  You could run into something like a wall or a bear!           One of the new researches for you is in the Artificing tab, which will show you how to make the Goggles of Revealing. When worn, these will make Aura Nodes glow as if you were looking through a Thaumometer.                                On top of that, every Node you scan with a Thaumometer will be 'remembered' by your Thauminomicon, and you can press i on your keyboard (by default) to show a list, and have an arrow show up when you are wearing your Goggles of Revealing! Quite handy!

To finish off your lesson of basic Wand Crafting, you'll need to use something a little nicer for your Wand core. Normal wooden sticks are all well and good at the beginning, but not very Thaumic, no?                                             Exploring around, you may have seen some great big trees made of dark wood, usually with cobwebs among the branches. These are Greatwood Trees, and their wood great Wand material! Locate one and cut it down, and try to get a few Saplings from the leaves as well!                                              Afterward, research the Greatwood Wand Core in the Artifice tab and make one. When you make a Wand out of Greatwood, it can hold twice as much Vis as your starter Wand!

Now that we have improved the core of the Wand, we can improve the Caps as well. Gold is a fantastic conductor, not only of electricity, but also magic! Unlike Iron, it has no Vis penalty when used in a Wand.

quests.name: Intermediate Wandcraft
quests.description: Now that you've got a solid basis in making and using Wands, I think it's time to expand on what you can do with them!                        Wand Cores and Wand Caps are not the only way to improve your Wand. Another way is to use Foci, special additions to your Wand you can swap around easily without having to make a new Wand. Each one does something different, and all are quite useful.                         Oh, a note on using and changing Wand Focus. You might need to rebind your Wand Focus key in the options under Miscellanious. Might I suggest Semicolon ( ; )?

tasks.longDescription: In your Thaumaturgy tab, the first Foci you can make is called Fire, under the Research : Wand Focus.                                          After making it you can attatch it to your Wand using the Wand Focus key (be sure to rebind it!) and selecting it from the radial menu that pops up. Now when you hold the Wand and Right Click, a stream of fire will jet out!                 If you want to remove a Focus, Sneak when you hit the Wand Focus key.
Researching the Excavation Wand Focus gives you quite a handy tool, letting you dig through many materials

Researching the Equal Trade focus will give you quite a useful tool for decorating and designing constructions. It allows you to exchange one type of material in the world for another in your Inventory!                                     To choose the material you want to change something TO, place it in the world, and Sneak + Right Click your Wand on it with the Focus equipped. You can then Left Click on a block to exchange it with your chosen block, as long as you have it in your Inventory.                        Right Clicking will exchange a whole group of blocks, if you have enough materials! It will only exchange blocks that have one face touching the open Air though!

Wiggle gets annoyed when I just leave my Wand Foci around, so now that you've got a couple we should probably make some sort of Storage for it.                                Researching the Focus Pouch will enable you to safely store all your Wand Foci, as well as easily exchange which one your Wand is using, which most other bags do not let you.

These two Foci are quite useful for attacking and defending yourself.                                      The Frost focus will fire a solid, icy projectile that will bounce off things. Careful, cause it can hurt you, but it can also be angled right to hit something around a corner.         The Shock focus simply hurls bolts of lightning at your target!

quests.name: The Basics of Alchemy
quests.description: I think its time to teach you about another Thaumatic principle : Alchemy. Throwing a bunch of ingredients in a pot, add a final touch, and wizard you got a spell going on. Or a complete mess, one of the two!                                     Yes, Alchemy is pretty much tossing a bunch of ingredients into what we call a Cauldron, and then poof you got something new! But what items? What ingredients? What order? Does it matter if its the heart of a swamp-born Creeper or a desert-born? Just what species of bird is required for the right Feather?                                       As a Thaumaturge, you'll learn the answer to these questions are : Sometimes! Usually it doesn't matter, except when it does! Isn't Magic fun?

tasks.longDescription: Okay, to start with we'll need a simple Cauldron. Place it over some sort of flame or heat source. I prefer making a nice looking area out of stone, with a bit of Lava right under the Cauldron.                  When you have that, go ahead and Right Click one of your Wands onto it to turn it into a Crucible.

Now, got some water in your Crucible? If not, go add some. Go on!                                              So the first thing we'll learn how to make is Nitor, which is a magical flame. The research is in your Alchemy tab. To make them, we'll need certain aspects. If you hold Shift and highlight items in your inventory, if you've scanned them with your Thaumometer you'll see what Aspects make it.
