For Nitor, we'll need 3 Lux, 3 Ignis, and 3 Potentia, as well as a Glowstone Dust to bind it all together.                The Lux is simple, just grab 3 normal Torches! The Potentia and Ignis is a bit more difficult...until you look at Charcoal, and a single piece has two of each! Grab two Charcoal as well!                              Now go over to your Crucible, and throw in the three Torches, the two Charcoal, and LAST throw in the Glowstone. You'll want to do this fast, as Aspects in the Crucible will break down if you aren't fast enough.

Good, you got the Nitor! And, well, something else perhaps?             Sometimes when you have a lot more Aspects in your Crucible than you need for an Alchemisation, it will break down and come out of the Crucible as a Purple liquid or gas. Well, this is what we call Taint. And it isn't good, but its part of the balance of the World.                        I suggest carrying some Dirt or Wood, and Sneak + Right Clicking the top of the cauldron to place it when you see the Purple gunk to break it up.                                    Now then, go ahead and research Alumentum on your Alchemy tab and make it. You'll use Charcoal like in the Nitor recipe, but it wants Perdito instead of Lux, and the Catalyst (the last object you throw in) is another piece of Charcoal.                                       I'll give you a hint on finding Perdito if you are having trouble : It's everywhere just a bit under your feet.                                     Now be careful with it, it's a bit more...volatile...than Nitor.

Magic Tallow is a useful in many Thaumaturgic applications. The research can be found in the Alchemy tab, and it is fairly simple to make.                                        You will need some Rotten Flesh from a Zombie for the Catalyst, as well as a few Praecantio Aspect. This aspect is a little harder to find, but the easiest to me is using Moss Cobblestone, which you can make with some Cobblestone, a Bucket of Water, and a single Wheat.    You can take the resulting Magic Tallow and turn into a Tallow Candle, which has some slight magical properties I'll cover later.

Sorry about naming all these tasks after that very old Witch poem. It's a little joke and rivalry we have between the Thaumaturge and Witchcraft branches in the Ferret Business. We have the utmost respect with each other, though, as we both strive to protect this world from Darkness.        What? No, I'll cover that later, don't worry! For now, we're breaking apart from the Natural traditions of Witchcraft and I will teach you how to transmute Metal!       Yes yes, Lead into Gold is possible, but very inefficient. You can make more by selling Lead as a commodity to the right Market! No, instead, research the Magical Metallurgy in the Alchemy tab.              This will teach you how to make Thaumium, which is a magical metal, quite useful in many things, not in the least in armor and tools!

The last basic thing you can make you don't even need to research. It's just an item you'll need for many other Thaumaturgic excursions.                                   By taking one of the Crystal Shards, and throwing it into a Crucible that contains TWO of each other missing basic element, you will create a Balance Shard.                  For example, if you have an Order Shard, you need to add Perdito, Aqua, Ignis, Aer, and Terra to the Crucible.

quests.name: The Basics of Research
quests.description: Hmm hmmm, okay, you have some materials, enough to get you started at least. To properly understand Magic, you'll need to do what every grand wizard has done since the dawn of time : research!        Now don't give me that look. To properly control the power  you can wield, you'll need to research how it works and how to harness it. Given your world is under strange...rules...this is also a matter of safety for both of us! I mean, if you summoned some tentacled beast from the dungeon dimension, boy would both our faces be red!              From all the blood, that is. Ours. I'm not sure their blood is red...or if they even bleed....

tasks.longDescription: A good Thaumaturge needs a sturdy desk, a quill and ink, and some nice writing paper.                    For the desk, you'll want to make two Tables (make sure they are Thaumcraft style ones!). This will give you plenty of tabletop space, cause invariably you'll cover half of it with piles of random junk.           Or is that just me? I'm pretty sure it's a wizardly thing...

Now, place the two Tables side by side, then Right Click the Scribing Tools on top. This will arrange them into a Research Table. Now Right Click the Table to start researching!                          In the Table, you can see the Scribing Tools in the upper left. To the right of that, a place for Paper.  Below these you should see a handfull of colored symbols : these are called Aspects. Almost everything in the universe is made of these, from Stones to Tools to Monsters, and there are lots of them.                                             Right now, you only know the basic ones. To learn more, you can combined two aspects by clicking them, then clicking the button with two arrows pointing at each other. Many combinations will not work, though, and each combination will consume a research point from that Aspect.                                       To get more research points, make the Thaumometer and just explore a bit. Hold it and aim at something, then hold Right Click to scan it. At the start, you can't scan many things, but as your Thaumatic Knowledge increases, more things will be scannable! You can also scan items in chests and your own inventory : Pick up the Thaumometer and just hold it over the item to scan it.                                        Again, Wiggles and I want to emphasize that you should scan EVERYTHING you can. Items, creatures, whatever! You won't be able to scan much to start, but each new Aspect you unlock will allow you to scan even more!

On the Basic Information tab of your Thauminomicon, click and drag to go to the right side of the researches you can do. You'll see one marked Research Expertise with an eye for a symbol. It should be flashing. Any knowledge flashing like this means you can begin research on it, if you click it when you have Scribing Tools and Paper in your inventory.                           Click it so you get a set of Research Notes. You can then place it into the research table, in the Paper slot, and the right side will unveil the research grid for you. It's a bit complicated, so please refer to the Thauminomicon for better instructions!

In Thaumcraft there are two ways things are researched. I've explained the more complicated one to you already.                               The other is a bit simpler : some researches the Thauminomicon only requires a payment of certain Aspects to divulge its secrets to you.

Now, originally Wiggles and I came up with these Crystal Clusters as a way to make this place look even more wizard. But we found out that the ones near our Research Table appeared to do something else : The Aspects of the Crystal Clusters nearby very slowly regenerated in the table!           The recharge rate is super slow, but it's really better than nothing! You can make a Mixed Crystal Cluster with one of each type of basic Shard, but if you use six of a single type, you make a Crystal Cluster of that one.

quests.name: Penultimate Research
quests.description: Greetings, Bandit. it has been a while since I last contacted you. I am Caigan, CEO of The Ferret Business. I'm extremely pleased at all the progress you've done! It has really helped us improve so many things, get new products on the market, and learn way more about teleportation technology than we've thought possible.              Unfortunately, this has not lead us to a way to get you home. Discover new dimensions and travel to and from them? Sure, we can do that now. Teleport large distances on the same world with very little cost? Yes, we can do that now too thanks to you.                                 But...your predicament has stumped all of our researchers ...and myself. I've taken a personal interest in you, and have created a small team with my very best researchers. I feel the only way to get you home is to delve into the more... mythical approaches.

tasks.longDescription: Our research does not come free. The materials for this are very rare, and I'm going to have to scour some obscure locations for them...                                           But I will give you this for the initial investment. May it be a light to you in dark places, when all other lights go out.                                  Sorry, I always wanted to use that quote! Here, this match is the first step in my research. It may look like a normal match, but it will create a fire that burns hot, but does not spread. Each match only ignites one fire, but if you put 9 of them together into a Matchbox, you mystically get way more fires!

quests.name: Crystal Growth
quests.description: [Gardener Greg]                             Now then, ya know how to make the soil and the infuser and the blank Universal Seed. Now we can actually make a Seed. I'll have you test it with something easy to find anywhere...Sand!                              Take 32 Sand and a Universal Seed and put them into the Infuser and hit Infuse. You'll get a Sand Seed in return.

tasks.longDescription: After you make the sand Seed, go ahead and plant it in the Powered Soil and, well...put in RF Energy to the soil.                           Every seed takes a certain amount of time and power to grow, depending on the Tier of he seed. When its fully grown, you can Right Click it to harvest Rough Shards from it.

Ya might notice each time ya harvest the Sand Seed, it gives you a varying amount of Shards back. If you want to increase how many Rough Shards ya get, use a Scythe.      That Invent'n guy mentioned that Tinker's scythes MAY work, but he isn't sure, so best to use Fluxed Crystal ones.

Now, them Rough Shards aren't ready to turn into useful materials yet, but ya CAN turn em into some rough tools, if you need em in a pinch.                                           Ya can make swords, pickaxes, axes, shovels, and hoes.

To make gathering Rough Shards easier, you can install this Upgrade into the soil. Just hold the Upgrade and Right Click it onto the soil. When fully grown, it will automatically harvest.                                       Do note that you won't get the best yield this way. You'll also need to find a way to collect the Shards yourself.

quests.name: Armor of the Wyvern
quests.description: Now that we have Wyvern Tools, its only logical that the next step we take is to make armor with Draconium and the various Cores.       Just like the tools, Wyvern Armor needs to be charged with RF Energy to function.

tasks.longDescription: It is a fantastic thing to note, though : By wearing a FULL Set of Wyvern Armor, you become completely immune to fire!

quests.name: Somewhat Dislocated
quests.description: With the research into teleportation and the Dislocation Charm continuing, we looked into ways to mount the Charm into a machine, as well as other ways to teleport and distort reality.               First, we wanted a way to teleport to a destination saved in the Disloaction Charm, but leave the Charm behind for others to use, and we've succeeded in making a...well, a magical pedastal for your Dislocation Charms. The bonus of using the Pedastal is that it will not consume charges on your Charms.       The second thing we discovered is that we could replace the head of an Arrow with an Ender Pearl, but it can only be fired with one of the Draconic Bows. It also is a whole lot more dangerous... bring some safe falling gear at minimum...                             The final thing we've learned is how to make a Draconic Flame, which seems to distort whatever its placed against, allowing us to peer through it like a magic mirror.

tasks.longDescription: If you rename the basic Charm in an Anvil, or have a destination set with the Enhanced version, it will display the name of the location above the Pedastal when you place the Charm in it.

quests.name: A Bit of Basics
quests.description: As I may have mentioned, I...well, I'm not from this dimension. I was summoned here by Master Watson and we formed a magical contract. I work for him for thirty years, and we share the power in the end and I return home.                                Er...yeah...um...where were we? Oh yes, Aura! Aura comes in many colors, but the most common is White. Each color behaves in a certain way when moving between Nodes and being Pumped higher.          Why don't we create something similar to the design in the Primer I gave you?

tasks.longDescription: White Aura Crystals are the standard. Right Clicking one onto an Aura Node will add a thousand White Aura to the Node.                             Nodes are where Aura is stored. They connect on the same horizontal level if they are directly North, South, East, or West of each other, and within 16 blocks. Connected Nodes will share Aura until they reach equilibrium.                Nodes will also connect vertically, but Aura will not flow upwards on its own, only downward.

So, I mentioned Aura can't move upwards on its own (usually..) right? Well...to make Power, we kind of need to, unless we want to waste a lot of materials making thousands of Crystals...                                  This is where Pumps come in. They connect to an Aura network just like a regular node, but feed a pump the proper material and it will send Aura upward to another connected node.                             For example : The Burning Aura Pump will consume Coal or other burnable material to move Aura upwards. Just drop the material next to the pump and it will consume it.

So, when Aura flows downward in a network, it generates Power. Kind of like a watermill. This Power can be used for a variety of things, usually in something we call a Consumer.                                     Consumers...well uh...consume Power. The name is pretty spot on....they consume Power to do a task. What they do and how much Power varies on the Consumer.            For example, the Cascading Processor is a Consumer, and one of the main ones you'll need.

This might be useful for you to make as well. The Monitor can be placed next to any Pump or Consumer.                                     If next to a Pump, when it is no longer Pumping, the Monitor will emit a Redstone Signal.                           If next to a Consumer, when it no longer has any work, the Monitor will emit a Redstone Signal as well.

quests.name: Auramatic Metal
quests.description: Could you set up an Aura Network for that Cascading Processor I had you build? I can...I mean...just take your time. no rush, right?                                          Got it? Okay...well, the Cascading Processor is used to fuse some basic materials into Arcane materials. They'll be infused with some Aura, and we'll need them to make better Cascading Consumers, Pumps, and other things!                   What will you need? Well, uh...a bunch of Iron will be good. And Diamonds! No wait, thats later...Oh oh, and some Wool. In lots of colors!

tasks.longDescription: With Arcane materials, there are 8 basic colors : Black, White, Blue, Red, Orange, Green, Yellow, and Purple.                                         The first tier of material is Metal. You get it by dropping an Iron Ingot and a Wool of the color you want next to a Cascading Processor. Supply enough Power and it'll fuse them into an Arcane Ingot!                                          Could you make 3 of each color, please? I know it seems like a lot, but you'll need all of them!

quests.name: Colorful Auras
quests.description: I mentioned that Aura comes in lots of colors, right? I'm pretty sure I did...                                    Well, yes, there are a few colors of Aura other than White! Each one has special properties to it. Some of these are easier to Pump upwards, others produce more Power when its raining.               Mastering the various colors of Aura can enable you to create a lot of Power for much less than just using White Aura.

tasks.longDescription: Blue Aura is really easy to Pump upwards. It takes a fourth of the energy to Pump upward, but only while its raining. Otherwise, it will take twice as much power to Pump!       Either way, it produces the same amount of Power when falling.

Green Aura changes weight depending on if its day or night.           During the day, it weighs twice as much as White Aura, so it takes 2x more to Pump upward, but produces 2x more Power.                   At night, it weights 50% of White Aura, so its easier to Pump, but produces half the Power as well.

Yellow Aura is easier to Pump, taking only half the energy of White Aura, while still producing the same amount of Power.                              The downside is that Yellow Aura will slowly break down while in Aura Nodes, meaning you'll have to supply more at some point.

Violet Aura will multiply itself in an Aura Node until it reaches 2.5k Violet Aura. You can spread it among multiple Nodes and it will keep multiplying, but if it ever drops below 25 Aura in a Node, it will dissipate, going away.

These two colors of Aura are special, as they can be considered alternates to each other.                   Black Aura will not flow downhill, nor Pump uphill. It will only travel horizontally.                                   Orange Aura, though, will only flow vertically.                                There is a special device you can use to convert between the two I will talk about later.
Red Aura has a unique property in that when TNT is detonated next to a node with Red Aura, it will instead absorb the explosion and move the Red Aura vertically, much like a Pump.

quests.name: The Powerful Vortex
quests.description: The Cascading Processor is a good device, but its pretty uh...weak? No not weak...low tech! Let's go with that! It's still useful, just not very powerful!                    Many things we'll create will need a whole lot more Power infused into them. To accomplish this, we'll need to use Vortex Infusion!                                        Vortex Infusion allows us to combine and infuse up to four items into one powerful item! These items will take longer to create, so you'll need to either automate your Aura Network, or tend to it yourself!            Many recipes will also require you to generate Power with a specific color of Aura. So having a really good setup is important!

tasks.longDescription: The primary thing we'll need is the Vortex Controller. This is another Power Consumer device, and it will require a lot of Power for each item.

As I said, the Controller will need a lot of Power, but you can't supply it with just basic Aura Nodes.                                          Instead, you'll need to make four Vortex Pedastals, and place them directly North, South, East, and West of the Controller.                These will act just like a normal Aura Node, collecting Power and sharing Aura through the network, but they will also hold the items you need for each Vortex Infusion.

There are a lot of things you can make with Vortex Infusion. You can combine 4 Rotten Flesh into 1 Leather, for example. Just Right Click the item onto each Vortex Pedastal to place it.                         You can also infuse higher tier materials for crafting. If you take 3 of any Arcane Metal (see why I had you make that many?), and a Diamond, and put them into the Vortex Infuser, you can make an Arcane Gem of that color!                 I won't ask you to make all 8 colors, just one: Violet!

quests.name: Quite Prismatic
quests.description: Didn't I say the Cascading Processor was kinda...low end? Well, I have good news!                           With the addition of Arcane Gems to our material list, we can now combine them into a third level of material!                                        Grab one of each color  Arcane Gem (thats 8, remember!), and toss them down near a Cascading Processor! Feed it some Power, and out will pop an Arcane Prism!              I'll note though...while it takes the same amount of Power to do a task...it requires a lot more Power at one time, so it will work faster as long as it is properly Powered!

tasks.longDescription: While it doesn't look like much, the Arcane Prism has lots of infused Aura power within it!

The Prismatic Processor does everything the Cascading Processor does.                             Though, instead of turning Ore into 2 Dust, it turns it into 3!              It can also break down colored Wool into its respective Dye!

quests.name: Angels of Metal
quests.description: So, we've been making a lot of just...materials right? Materials and devices. Well, I have some more materials for us to make, but this material is very special!                    Angel's Steel is a very powerful metal. You've heard of folding metal a thousand times, correct? That is sort of what Angel's Steel is, except we're folding in thousands of Power into each ingot!                   You will first need a Cascading Synthesizer. More importantly, though, you'll need a really good Aura  Power setup! Angel's Steel requires 10,000 Power per step...thats 10,000 Power each 'cycle'!                                        Needless to say, I don't think just a few Burning Aura Pumps will suffice for this...

tasks.longDescription: Some Iron Ingots and an Arcane Prism, and a whooole lot of Power, will create the Synthesizer. It's only task is to create Angel's Steel by folding and condensing Power into an Ingot.
Angel's Steel is classified in Degrees. A freshly synthesized Ingot will be of the First Degree.

You can use Angel Steel Ingots much like Iron to make tools.  You can make a Pickaxe, an Axe, or a Shovel.                                          Angel's Steel Tools have four properties, and a First Degree tool will have only the lowest levels in them.                                             Efficiency : Dig Speed.                  Fortune : Bonus Drops.                 Shatter : Increases speed on harder materials.                             Disintegration : Increases speed on very soft materials.

By shaping Angel's Steel into a blade and using an Aura Crystal as a handle, you get a powerful Sword, which causes special things to happen when you hit an enemy with the sword:                                      Red : Causes fires to randomly start.                                            Orange : Causes enemies to randomly fly into the air.                    Yellow : Causes lightning to strike.                                           Green : Causes a sickness that spreads.                                        Blue : Will start rapidly damaging the enemy when they are below half health.                             Violet : Causes instability, the enemy will occasionally switch places with other entities nearby.

Angel's Steel of the first degree is fairly powerful, but that is only the beginning. Like folding steel, the more you fold it, the more powerful it becomes!                        By dropping 3 of the same degree of Angel's Steel next to a Synthesizer, it will automatically fold them into a single Ingot of the next degree.                                 There are 11 degrees of Angel's Steel. Each degree beyond the first will grant tools bonus Dig Speed. Each degree will also add 2 points to a tool's special stats, randomly distributed between them.

quests.name: Speciality Nodes
quests.description: The basic Aura Node is good for most things, yeah? Well, to make the most of Aura, you'll want to use some of these special nodes in your designs!

tasks.longDescription: The Conserving Aura Node will not send  Aura downhill. It's helpful when making more compact designs, or when using something like Red Aura.

Red and Orange Aura both work differently, which I explain in another place. These two Manipulators are special, though.        When they have no Redstone Signal, they will only accept their chosen color and destroy it.              With a Redstone Signal, the Manipulator Node will generate more of its chosen color.

The Aura Capacitor will collect Aura without sending it back out until it reaches its capacity, which can be configured by Shift + Right Clicking it.                                      When it goes over this threshhold, it will release its Aura all at once, and then go into a cooldown mode for a few seconds where it will not collect any more Aura.

I've studied some of your world and notice you use a lot of this energy you call Redstone Flux, or RF. Well, the Master helped me design this special Node to convert Power into RF Energy.                      It creates an Aura Bubble around it and adjacent RF Energy machines, powering up to 4 of them.      Note though, that the Aura Bubble looks out for Pipes in the bubble or connected to the bubble. If more than 4 Machines/Pipes are connected, it will not power them, so you cannot power an entire construction with a Fluxing Node.

quests.name: Pumped Up
quests.description: Those Burning Aura Pumps aren't the greatest, huh? They're pretty simple to make, though, and a good introduction to them. I got a lot more I can show you!                   Each of these pumps requires a different kind of "fuel" to power. Sometimes its a material it consumes, like the Burning Pump consumes burnable things like Coal. Others require some sort of interaction, like being shot with an arrow.              Pumps have two parts to them : Speed, which is how much Aura they pump at once, and Duration, which is how long they pump for.

tasks.longDescription: The Illumination Pump will consume Torches placed near it to Pump Aura.                                     It will also consume Glowstone in the same way, and provide more Duration than a torch, but the same Speed.                                          It's important to note that only 'normal' Torches and Glowstone will usually work. The Pump is kind of picky.
The Projectile Pump feeds off things being thrown or shot at it. Specifically, Snowballs, Arrows, and Eggs. Each one of these gives a different amount of Speed and Duration.

The Redstone Aura Pump will consume a line of up to 15 Redstone Dust, but only when its powered (Which will let you place the Redstone down first, without it suddenly vanishing on you!).              Place down the Redstone Dust in a line leading from the Pump. Each dust adds more Duration. Use a Redstone Torch to power the end of the Redstone Dust line, and the Pump will consume the line.
The Momentum Aura Pump is fueled by creatures falling near it.     Each blocks worth of height the creature has fallen from adds to the Pump's Duration.

One of the improvements the Master has helped me with on these Pumps is to create what we call Alternating Pumps.                           These pumps are more efficient, but at a cost. Their output amount varies wildly over about an eight minute period. The Master calls it 'sinusoidally' I believe, which I've come to understand is kind of like a rollercoaster.                                 If you can time things fairly well, I feel you can take really good advantage of these. Since you'll have spare Burning Pumps, I'll only ask you to make an Alternating one of them, though each Pump has an alternating version.

quests.name: Bombastic Rituals
quests.description: So, I've come to understand you have two special worlds right next to yours on the dimensional planes. The Master says that you've started calling them The Nether and The End. Both are also quite dangerous by the sounds of it!           So what if you could convert a small area of your world into a slice of one of those? Safer, more controllable, and less dangerous.       Well, I know of a special Ritual that should allow you to do just that! The Rituals are contained within a device you use much like any other Consumer : feed it enough Power over time to activate it.

tasks.longDescription: The Ritual of the Nether will steadily convert the Biome you place this device into a Nether biome while it is being Powered. It will transmute the appropriate blocks into their Nether equivilants as well.
Works just like the Ritual of Nether, except it brings a nice slice of the End home to you.

quests.name: Knowledge is Storage
quests.description: Ever heard the term Knowledge is Power? Most likely, its pretty commonly said around here. Well, books contain knowledge. and possessions denote power (the more you have, the more 'powerful' you are), and with Aura, you can now store items in books!                   Sounds crazy, right? Well, I'll try to explain it as best I can. You can also look at the Encyclopedia Aura for a more in depth explanation.

tasks.longDescription: To start, you'll need to make a Storage Book. You'll also need some 'regular' bookshelves. Master calls them "Vanilla" bookshelves, as they aren't fancy or anything.                  When you Right Click a Storage Book onto a Bookshelf, it will turn Purple and convert it into a Book Storage Shelf.

To interact with this Book storage system, you'll need a Bookshelf Coordinator.  You'll need to constantly Power the Bookshelf Coordinator as well, as the more items you store, the more Bookshelves you have, the more Power it requires.                           All Storage Bookshelves you want to connect to the Coordinator have to:                                        1) Be connected together with other Storage or normal Bookshelves, and                            2) Have Line of Sight to the Coordinator.                                  You can then access the Storage system by Right Clicking the Coordinator.
There are a wide variety of Storage Books you can make. Each one stores items differently. These are two common ones to use, but you can reference the Encyclopedia Aura for all the rest.

quests.name: Arcane Tools
quests.description: I know a lot of what we've done is just make and condense Power into better and better materials, so how about we utilize them in more interesting ways?                           These items and tools should be quite helpful in various ways, and I dare say some of them are especially useful to you in your current...well, predicament.

tasks.longDescription: The Mirror of the Angel should help you when fighting those strange, haunting creatures called Ghasts.                                         You can Left Click on a Ghast Fireball, or Right Click close to it to reflect the Fireball back towards the closest Ghast. It will also speed up the Fireball!

We can harness the Power in these materials in various interesting ways. Some of the most interesting are the Portable Holes.      The Portable Black Hole will consume all the Cobblestone in your inventory. Great for long mining trips!                                   The Portable Red Hole is arguably more useful. Its also, not arguably, much much much more dangerous. When dropped on the ground, it will literally explode every 5 seconds. And when I say explode, I mean a pretty big explosion. You'll need some kind of heavy duty armor or protection versus explosions to use this properly...

The Sword of the Barbarian is an excellent weapon for fighting very strong monsters or large groups of them.                               Every time you hit an enemy within 5 seconds of the last hit increases the damage of the weapon.                                         Can you get to a 100 hit combo?
The Sword of the Thief is a uh...bit more of a bad person's tool.      Every Villager you kill with the sword will have a 25% chance of dropping the item they were offering for trade.

The Transmuting Sword will, well... transform... common creatures between two states. Here's the list for you :                                       Cow - Mooshroom                        Sheep - Pig                               Ghast - Blaze                             Slime - Magma Cube                      Ocelot - Wolf

The Prismatic Wand can definitely help you copy your constructions. It has three modes: Select, Copy, and Paste; you can switch between them by Shift + Right Clicking the Wand.                            In Select Mode, Right Click two corners of a cube shape that contains the structure you want.        Switch to Copy mode and Right Click it to copy it.                            Lastly, in Paste mode, Right Click where you want to copy the structure to. It will consume all the blocks from your inventory, so make sure you have everything you need!

quests.name: General Consumption
quests.description: Now, we've made a bunch of materials, right? A few other things but...mostly materials. How about we put them to use, yes?                       These are some pretty simple things you can make. Three of them are Consumers, which will require Power to do tasks. The other two are some basic construction materials you can make.

tasks.longDescription: You'll need a lot of colored Wool for making Arcane materials, and the Cascading Colorer will help you!     For a little bit of Power, it will constantly cause Sheep near it to regrow their Wool, and it will also dye it a random color.
The Cascading Smelter, as long as it is given Power, will Smelt items dropped near it, like turning Ore into Ingots. It will also prevent any items dropped near it from despawning.

Master says you don't really have much transportation over there, other than Minecarts and some teleportation. Sometimes I like to just walk around though, but you don't get very far...                   Traveler's Bricks will help here! Make a roadway with them, and when you start running on them, they'll speed you up really fast in the direction you are going!

The Rebounding Enigma is a dangerous block, just to warn you! If you or any other creature steps on it, it will catapult you hundreds of blocks into the air!         I suggest carrying a parachute or something...

Oh oh, my Master has just helped me finish a new thing you might be interested in! See, I like fish...a lot...and well I wanted so...huh? Oh sorry!                         The Cascading Fisher, when placed over a 3x3 area of Water, will automatically fish for you when Powered!

quests.name: Bits and Baubles
quests.description: So we've made a lot of interesting this so far! Materials, some devices, maybe a weapon or two perhaps...but not too much on the more defensive side, right?           Well, time to change that. I know of a bunch of different amulets and rings and stuff that should really help you out!                        (You can equip Baubles by opening your Inventory, and hitting the small ring button in the upper right of your portrait.)

tasks.longDescription: With enough String, you can turn some of the Arcane Gems into protective amulets! You can only wear one at a time, but each one protects you from something different :                                     Red protects you from Fire and Lava.                                           Orange protects you from Explosions.                                    Yellow protects you from Projectiles.                                   Green protects you from Fall Damage.                                        Blue protects you from Drowning.                                      Purple protects you from the effects of the Wither, but you won't regenerate health.

Faries are constructs made of Aura that can help you in a wide variety of ways.                             To harness their power, you'll first need to make a Ring of Binding and equip it.                                  Then you need to make a basic Fairy Charm. On its own, it won't do anything, but you can further augment it in a wide variety of ways, which are detailed in the Encyclopedia Aura.                         You can then hold and Right Click a Fairy Charm to put into the Ring of Binding if you have it equipped. It can hold up to 15 Fairies. To remove them, hold the Ring of Binding and Shift + Right Click.

The Ring of the Shattered Stone will absorb most of energy from an explosion within 4 blocks. The blast will then only affect things like Stone, Dirt, and Gravel, and leave more precious resources intact.

The Amulet of the Forbidden Fruit will apply a random potion effect to you each time you eat any food.                                      The same food item will always grant the same potion effect.

Amulet of the Angel's Wing will allow you to travel vertically fairly quickly.                                         By pressing Up on your keyboard, you will teleport up through terrain to the next safe standing spot, if there is one.            Pressing Down will do the same, except you'll descend through terrain.

Sash of the Angel's Heels will allow you to travel up hills with ease.                                           Just by moving toward a hill, you will instantly walk up to three block high hills. If you encounter a vertical wall thats higher, walking against it will charge the Sash and eventually allow you to step on top of the obstical.

quests.name: Advanced Consumption
quests.description: I've shown you how to make some pretty simple Consumers right? Now with some Arcane Gems, we can make some even more powerful ones!                                These Consumers will take a bit more Power than the basic ones, keep in mind. But with great Power comes...well, better results!

tasks.longDescription: The Cascading Grower will speed up the growth of most plants above it.                                                Place a Dirt block on top of the Grower, then till it and plant a crop. When Powered, the plant will grow much faster!

Gathering all the materials for the various Potions becoming troublesome? Well, the Cascading Brewer can help.                             By dropping Water Bottles near the Brewer and supplying enough Power, it will randomly add brewing ingredients to it. The potion you'll end up with will be random, but you won't have to supply anything but Water Bottles.
The Cascading Looter requires a lot of Power, but in return it will randomly create items you can find in any Dungeon chest!
While being Powered, the Cascading Spawner will spawn creatures and monsters above it.      The creatures it can spawn represent any you'd usually find in that area.

The Kaleidoscope Enchanter is a very interesting Consumer. It will imbue Swords or Tools with one or more Color based Enchantments.          The difference with these enchantments is colors will interact and combine with each other in different ways, vastly increasing the number of possibilities.                 You should consult the Encyclopedia Aura to see all the combinations and how to use the Enchanter properly.

quests.name: Singularity Mining
quests.description: We have sooo much Power condensed into all these materials, don't we? So much Power that if we aren't careful, it could collapse on itself...                                          Nah not really! But that thought does segway nicely into this little device. See, if you condense enough Power in a certain way, you can make it collapse on itself into a Singularity. While very dangerous, this Singularity can be harnessed by us to draw resources from other dimensions.                            So, to create and harness this Singularity, we'll need a Cascading Miner and some Fortified Blocks.           I highly suggest building this away from your base or anything you hold dear...a Singularity that prematurely collapses causes quite the explosion...

tasks.longDescription: The first thing you'll need to do is create a chamber with Fortified Blocks. You can make these with a Cascading Processor by mixing End Stone with one of six blocks : Dirt, Cobblestone, Stone, Glass, Wood Planks, or Obsidian.                           Each material takes a different amount of damage to break, and repairs at a different speed. If a Fortified Block takes too much damage, it will be destroyed.

The Cascading Miner, when Powered, will generate a Singularity 1.5 blocks below it. When a Redstone Signal is applied to it, it will collapse the Singularity and create Ores from the energy.                             While the Singularity exists, it will move around. If it hits a Fortified Block, it will damage the area and bounce. Every bounce will increase the speed of the Singularity.              To generate any Ores at all, the Singularity must exist for at least 20 seconds. The longer it exists, the more Ore it will generate.             If the Singularity hits a non-Fortified Block? Well...don't. Simple as that. The block won't exist anymore, probably

quests.name: Node Manipulation
quests.description: As you progress as a Thaumaturge, you've probably noticed you've needed to visit old Aura Nodes and find many new ones, whether its to recharge a Wand, charge a new one, or obtain Essences from one.                         Well, this can definitely become a bit of a hassle, especially as bigger spells mean bigger costs. Thankfully, we have plenty of ways to deal with this, the least of which is just moving the Nodes to a much handier location!                             From there, you can manipulate nodes in various ways, build devices to utilize them better, etc.

tasks.longDescription: In your Basic Information tab, you should make sure you have Node Preserver and Master Node Tapping researched. This will open up the Research for Node in a Jar.     This unlocks the ability for you to create a Warded Jar...for an Aura Node, that is. By surrounding an Aura Node in Glass, and topping it with Wooden Slabs, you create a large jar. Right Clicking the Glass with a Wand that has 70 of each Vis in it and voila!                                 You have magically shrunk down this construct, freezing the Aura Node inside. You can now break the Jar to pick it up, and move the Aura Node to a new home! Just place it back down and Right Click your Wand on it to release it!

Nodes can be fickle creatures. If you place a few near each other, they can 'draw' vis from other ones to boost themselves. Some nodes are "Fading" and slowly losing Vis capacity. These make collecting Nodes a bit of a hassle.                                         In the Thaumaturgy tab, you'll find a bunch of useful devices. The first of which is the Node Stabilizer. When placed under a Node, it will stop it from drawing Vis from nearby Nodes. It also stops Fading Nodes from losing Vis, and has a small chance of repairing them into Pale Nodes.                                    The downside is the power to do this will come from the Node itself. The recharge rate of the Node will be halved to power the Stabilizer.

We've solved the 'running around' problem of recharging your Wand. Now we can solve the 'wave Wand at for power' part of it too!                                             The Wand Recharge Pedestal can hold any of your Wands, and will draw Vis from nearby Aura Nodes to recharge it.                       As long as you aren't using cheap Iron and Stick Wands, you won't run the risk of depleting and damaging the Nodes.

Invariably, you've probably come across a Node or two with Compound Aspects, the aspects you combine the 6 basic Aspects to create. Your Wand can't hold these at this point, but with this device, you can utilize them.                         The Compound Recharge Focus can be placed onto your Wand Recharge Station, and it will also draw Compound Aspects and break them down. Only one of the six Primal aspects will be saved, though.

Nodes tend to have a limited amount of Vis when you find them, and recharge quite slowly. Especially when you have them in a Node Stabilizer.                               Well, there is a way to 'open' the floodgates, so to speak, and draw more Vis through a Node. The Node Transducer is placed on top of an Aura Node that is in a Stabilizer. When you put a Redstone Signal to the Transducer, it will drain all the Vis from it as it converts it into an Energized Node.                          When it is finished, as long as the Redstone Signal is present on the Transducer, the Node will no longer produce Vis. Instead, it will produce Centi-Vis steadily. This cannot be abosrbed by your Wand directly.         Instead, Vis Relays can be placed within 8 blocks of a Transducer or another Vis Relay to create a CVis energy network. Some constructions, like the Alchemy Furnace or the Infernal Furnace, can draw CVis from this network and function more efficiently.                                      You can Right Click your wand on a Vis Relay to change its color. Colored Relays will only connect to each other. Each Relay can also only have one 'source', but can branch out to multiple other Relays.

One of the first helpful things you can make that utilizes the CVis network is the Flux Scrubber.            As you work in Thaumaturgy, especially in Alchemy, you'll most likely end up creating Flux, which is temporary form of Taint. It is also one of the ways it spreads, so leaving a large amount of Flux around is a bad idea.                       The Flux Scrubber will take Aer CVis and use it to clean up Flux nearby. It will convert some of it to Praecantio Essentia, which can be piped out or pulled out with a Glass Vial.                                             This Research will require you to of learned the Arcane Bellows research in the Artifice tab. The Dark Research quest in this book details about the Arcane Bellows.

quests.name: Advanced Foci
quests.description: With some of the new things and power you've researched in the Thauminomicon, you've opened up a handful of more Foci you can use.       Wiggles likes to use a couple of these Foci around the tower. They are quite useful for both getting around and protecting the place from... well, experiments gone awry let's say.                                      Ah well, you can find all these Researches in the Thaumaturgy tab.

tasks.longDescription: The power the C-Vis network gives us has opened up many doors to us. One of them is changing how our Wand Foci work.        When connected to a C-Vis network, the Focus Manipulator can change and upgrade almost any Wand Foci in various ways.                 Some upgrades can be taken multiple times, others only once. Some upgrades require lower tier ones first. Experimentation is key!       Unfortunately, there doesn't seem to be a way to remove upgrades.

The Portable Hole is a handy Focus to have around. It lets you tear a temporary hole through most simple materials, that stays open for a few seconds. This lets you make temporary doors and pathways, for exploring or escape.      The amount of Vis used depends on how much material you are making a Hole through. More complicated things like machines will not be cut through.

Invariably, with your trips to the Nether for materials, you've come across the most annoying creatures, on par with your fabled Creepers: Hellbats!                           Now, though, you can harness their annoyance and send them at your enemies! The Nine Hells focus allows you to fire off a Hellbat. You can even research a way to turn it into a Vampire bat, which has a chance of healing you when it attacks.                                        If you don't see the Nine Hells Foci in the Thauminomicon, try scanning a Firebat with your Thaumometer first.

You've made Warded Doors, Pressure Plates, and Glass, and each has its own place...but what if you could Ward most any simple material?                                       The Warding Focus lets you ward most simple materials. They become frozen in time, and cannot be interacted with or broken until you use your Wand on them again to Unward them.                              When holding your Wand with the Warding Focus, you'll be able to see all the blocks you and you alone have Warded.

quests.name: Metal Mania
quests.description: Now that you know how to make Thaumium, it's time to learn how to work the basic metals and ores better as well. Both in and out of Thaumaturgy, Metals are very widely used, and any method to increase them is helpful.                   In the Alchemy tab, off of the Thaumium research, are two more researches. After researching these, it'll open up a great number of researches. Thankfully, they only require Research Points to unlock, but you may miss one final research this unlocks pertaining to working Ore and Metal.                      The final tab, on the right side, of your Thauminomicon is labeled AOBD. It has a single research labeled Ore Purification, which you should also Research.

tasks.longDescription: By putting Ordo and Metallum Aspects into your Crucible, you can purify Iron Ore into Iron Clusters.      This purified version of the Ore, when smelted will give you two Iron Ingots instead of one!
Researching all the extra mentioned Purifications, including the AOBD one, will give you the ability to double almost every Ore you can get.

Ore Purification isn't the only thing you can do. By breaking down metals into Metallum, and mixing with a few other Aspects, you can Transmute them into different metals! Yes, this is where the Lead into Gold scenario comes into play!       It is quite simple to just break down an Iron Ingot into 9 nuggets, so why not take those 9 nuggets and triple them into 27 Iron Nuggets for me!                               Well, Wiggles says it isn't hard for you to just break down 2 more Ingots as well, but that's up to you I guess. You're a Wizard, Bandit, you can do it however you like.

quests.name: Infused Tools
quests.description: Now that you know how to do basic Infusion, it's time to learn many of the useful tools you can make! A lot has opened up in the Artifice tab for you!                        Be sure, as well, to make sure your Altar is as stable as possible. Remember, try to keep things as symmetrical as possible! Crystal shards, skulls, and candles all aid in stability.                                     Eventually, you'll want to balance at least twelve Arcane Pedestals in a pattern around the Infusion Altar. This is best done in a Clock pattern.                              When placing ingredients for symmetry in the Clock pattern, it's quite simple. When you place an ingredient, count 6 Pedestals in either direction for it's opposite. 12 O'Clock is 6 O'Clock. 4 O'Clock is 10 O'Clock.

tasks.longDescription: The Pickaxe of the Core imbues fire into a Thaumium Pickaxe. When mining with it, occasionally you will turn Ores into Native Clusters, doubling the Ingots they make.            You can also Right Click to survey the area for Ores.                If you want to use it like a normal Pickaxe, you can Sneak while mining with it.

The Axe of the Stream makes chopping down tall trees easy. When used on normal wood items, it acts like normal, but when chopping Logs and similar, the Axe takes effect.                                         When you chop a Log with the Axe of the Stream, it will instead break the furthest Log of the same type in an unbroken chain. So if you chop the bottom of a tree, it will start at the very top, working its way down. Each log will then flow down to you.                                 If you hold down Right Click while holding the Axe, it will draw all items nearby to you, not just Logs.           If you hold Sneak while using it, it will act like a normal axe.

The Sword of the Zephyr is a blade infused with the element of Air. When you strike with it, you'll slash in a wide arc and hit multiple enemies.                                         When you hold Right Click to block, you'll summon a wall of air around yourself, pushing enemies and objects back and deflecting projectiles. While this is active, you'll slowly lift into the air as well.

Shovel of the Earthmover is a great tool for both clearing soft materials and for building. When you dig with it, it will dig up a 3x3 area.       When you Right Click with it, though, it will attempt to place a 3x3 area of the same material you are aiming at, as long as it's in your inventory.                                     By Sneaking, you'll see where you are placing the blocks. You can change the shape of the pattern by hitting the hotkey. By default, this is G, but you'll have to rebind it if you want to use this function.           As usual, if you dig while Sneaking with this tool, it'll act like a normal shovel.

The Hoe of Growth is a farmer's helper. When Right Clicked onto dirt, it will till a 3x3 area.                        When Right Clicked onto a crop, it will act like Bonemeal, making it grow faster, but at the cost of some extra Durability from the Hoe.     Sneaking while tilling the ground will till a normal 1x1 area.

quests.name: Infused Devices
quests.description: The power Infusion grants us can be used in a wide variety of devices.  We can even make magical versions of various common 'technological wonders', even though these creations were first dreamed up by wizards centuries older than both of us.                        My familiar Wiggles says it doesn't really matter who thought it first, and I tend to agree. Usually. She doesn't have to have debates with some of the other departments on a regular basis like I do, though.

tasks.longDescription: Ah, you may have noticed this research much earlier. I chose not to show it to you yet, as while it is quite useful, it tends to have odd....interactions with various other devices and machines outside the Thaumaturge's area of study.         In the Artifice tab is the Arcane Lamp research. This Lamp will light up a large area, as it will create smaller lights within 16 blocks of it to remove all the dark spots it finds. These lights, though, are what can cause issues with other devices, so use these with a caution!

Taking the Arcane Lamps and Imbuing the energy of Life into them is a good way to turn them into something more useful.                By providing the Lamp of Growth with Herba Essentia (via Essentia Tubes), it will glow brightly. Plants touched by it's glow will grow at a faster rate than normal.                   The Lamp of Fertility works in a similar way, though it works off Victus Essentia. Animals in it's light will seek out a mate and have babies. This won't affect animals when there are 8 or more of it's type already present.

The Arcane Bore is a magical device that expands and improves on the Excavation Wand Focus.            You need to place the Arcane Bore on top or underneath a Base. Right Click your Wand on the Bore to aim it in the direction you want to excavate, and on the Base to change which direction it will deposit items (Don't forget to place a chest down!)                                When you open up the Bore, you can place an Excavation Focus in the left hand slot, and any Pickaxe in the right hand slot. The enchantments on both will effect the Bore, and the Durability of the Pick will effect how long the Bore can run.                                        To activate, simply supply a Redstone Signal. Supplying Perditio Essentia or CVis to the Bore will increase its speed.

quests.name: Infused Equipment
quests.description: We've made a pair of boots infused with Magic... and that is only the beginning!                                 Infusing pieces of armor, rings, and other such bits and baubles can be just as useful as an imbued sword. Combining all of them will keep you well protected and ready for any situation that arises.

tasks.longDescription: The Thaumostatic Harness imbues the power of Aer into a Leather Armor construction. This will enable you to fly in the air!            As long as you keep it powered, that is! The Harness is fueld by pure Potentia Essentia. Fill a Warded Jar with Potentia, and then Right Click while holding the Harness to open it. Place the Potentia Jar inside, and then wear it.                                                 To activate or deactivate the Harness, you'll need to rebind the Harness button from H in your options, under Miscellaneous. While active, it will drain Potentia from the Jar.                                              The Thermostatic Girdle, on its own, will negate most fall damage, but doesn't have enough power itself. When combined with the Harness, it will increase the speed you can move while flying, but at the cost of a bit higher Potentia consumption.

Researching Runic Shielding will aid you in keeping you alive, by showing you how to make a three piece set of jewelry : A Ring, An Amulet, and A Girdle of Runic Shielding.                                       The Runic Shielding works differently than normal armor. When you take damage, the Runic Shielding will take the hit first. If you take more damage than you have Shielding left, you will be hurt normally. Runic Shielding regenerates slowly by drawing Aer and Terra Vis from the Wands you carry.

You can improve on the Runic Shielding jewelry by imbuing both an Element and a magic potion to each one. Each one of these has a bit less Shielding power to them, but in exchange have special effects.       The Charged Ring of Shielding will speed up Shield Regeneration by 25%. You can wear two of them for 50% increase.                             The Revitalizing Ring of Shielding will release a burst of Regenerative energy when you are hit, but will only do so once every 20 seconds.                                   The Kinetic Girdle of Shielding will cause a burst of kinetic energy when you are hit, damaging and knocking back creatures around you. This can only happen once every 20 seconds.                          The Amulet of Emergency Shielding will, when you run out of Shielding, immediately add 8 Shielding Points to you. This can only happen once every minute.

quests.name: Golemancy
quests.description: The Hungry Chest was only the start to giving the spark of life and animation to your creations. Researching Straw Golems will open up a whole lot of new possibilities for you!                                         Golems are a great help to any Thaumaturge. They are simple creations, both in creation and in intelligence, but with some careful work and thought, you can create an army of Golems to help with many tedious tasks. From gathering, farming, sorting, there's a lot that can be done.                                    Wiggles loves the golems. She has her own little army of helpers.

tasks.longDescription: The first step in learning how to make and control golems is making the Straw Golem.                              Golems can be Right Clicked onto a block, or Shift + Right Clicked onto a chest or other block with an inventory, to place it. This will be the 'home' location for the Golem. The normal range for a Golem is 16 blocks from this Home.                       A freshly made and placed Golem will be inactive, though, as it needs....

...an Animation Core. Animation Cores give a golem function. Gathering, planting, etc. To give a placed Golem a Core, just Right Click it onto it.                                 You can then Right Click the Golem with the Gather Core and put specific items into it for it to gather. Otherwise, it will gather all dropped items in range.

The Golemancer's Bell is a specialized tool to help control Golems better. Given how simple minded these creations are, it's useful to avoid frustration.               By Right Clicking the bell on a placed Golem, a small glowing gear will appear on the block that is its Home. You can then Right Click on a location, a block, etc to Mark it. The Golem will only interact with these marked places. Right Click the Mark to either remove it, or cycle through the colors. Shift + Right Clicking a Mark will always remove it.      If you Left Click on a Golem with the Bell, it will allow you to pick it up with its Core and any upgrades on it. Shift + Left Clicking a placed golem will instead separate it into its different components, but any Cores and upgrades have a chance of being destroyed this way.

quests.name: Golem Goodies
quests.description: Sometimes, its a bit difficult to tell your Golems apart when you have a  lot of them. Wiggles could always tell them apart in a single glance, I don't know how.                   Thankfully, for us with less than stellar sight, we can create some nice accessories for them. Not only do they look good, but they also help boost the Golems in various ways!

tasks.longDescription: Sometimes its hard to get a Golem to stop what it's doing so you can put an accessory on it. By placing a Golem Fetter and powering it with a Redstone Signal, any Golem that walks over it will immediately pause what it's doing and stand there. When the Redstone Signal is turned off, the Golem will resume its task.
A Golem wearing a Top Hat will have more health and vitality.             A Golem wearing a Fez will regenerate health faster.
A Pair of Spectacles on a Golem will increase its range.                     A Visor, though, not only adds a little Armor to the Golem, it will also cause creatures it kills to drop XP Orbs.
The Bowtie will make a Golem move faster.                                  Iron Plating will increase the defense of a Golem that wears it, but will also weigh it down.
The Dart Launcher can only be attatched to combat Golems, and will give it a ranged attack.                      The Golem Mace will outright increase a Golem's melee damage.

quests.name: More Golems
quests.description: Expanding the types of Golems you can make brings lots of variety. Some golems are faster, others more durable.                       More advanced Golems have more capability to hold Upgrades, which improve them even more.

tasks.longDescription: Wooden Golems repair and move faster, but are a bit less durable and have slightly less strength.          Clay Golems are more durable and can carry more, but their self-repair is slower.
Stone Golems are stronger and more durable, but slower. They also weigh more and can sink in Water.        Iron Golems are much slower, but more durable and can carry a lot more.

Tallow Golems are average across the board, but are able to hold two Upgrades instead of one.        Flesh Golems aren't very durable or strong, but they repair very quickly and can have two Upgrades.
Thaumium Golems are fairly durable and strong, repair fast and can carry a lot. Their weight makes them move slower and sink in water.

quests.name: A Core Upgrade
quests.description: Golems have a wide variety of options, some of them more suited to different tasks.                           The major way to differentiate what a Golem can do is what Animation Core you give them. Each Core is a certain task it can do, giving you a variety of options.           Another way to customize your Golems is to give them Upgrades. Depending on what your Golem is made of will determine how many of these Upgrades it can have.              Some Upgrades also give certain Cores special boosts.

tasks.longDescription: The Empty core will have a Golem taking out all items from the Inventory marked as it's home, and bring it to Marked locations. If these Marked locations are inventories, it will put the items into it.                                                 The Fill core will search marked areas and chests for items, and place them into the Inventory marked as its home. It has two modes : Any and Precise. Any will fill the Home inventory with as many of the items it can find, while Precise lets you choose exactly how much to keep the inventory stocked with.       The Sorting core acts like the Empty core, but only if one of the items in it's Home Inventory matches one of the items in a Marked inventory. This is super useful for sorting things!

The Use core enables a golem to Left or Right Click on Marked areas. You can configure which button, what items it will use if its Home is an inventory, etc.                  The Decanting core, when put on a golem connected to a liquid inventory, will draw liquids from Marked areas to fill it. Place a bucket or other container of the liquid into the Golem to transfer only that liquid.                               The Alchemy core is a specialized Decanting core. When placed on an Alembic or Alchemy Furnace, it will move Essentia from it to Warded Jars that have been marked. They can also move Essentia between most containers and Essentia accepting blocks.

The Harvest core will make a Golem harvest fully grown plants in an area around its Home. It isn't smart enough to recognize every plant, nor is it smart enough to replant the seeds. Though, with the proper Upgrade, you can probably get it replanting seeds at least...         The Fishing core will enable a Golem to fish. It will do best when placed in deeper waters.                   The Chop core will make a Golem chop down all trees in an area around its Home. It will not, however, replant saplings. (Note, for this one, you'll need to have learned how to make the Axe of the Stream. Check the Infused Tools quest for more information!)

The Guard core will turn a Golem into a protector. It will guard the area of its Home, attacking all Hostile enemies who get close. With the proper Upgrade, you can change what it will target.                  The Butcher core will make a Golem kill farm animals. It is smart enough only to attack the oldest, fully grown animal, and it will always leave a pair of them for breeding more.

The Fire Upgrade will enable a Golem to filter or sort more items, and will give it's melee attack the abilty to ignite enemies.                     The Earth Upgrade will increase how much a Golem can carry, as well as how much damage it does. It will also speed up any task based on strength, such as harvesting.        The Air Upgrade will increase a Golem's Speed and its Ranged Attack Speed.

The Water Upgrade will increase the traveling range of a Golem.           The Order Upgrade will enable a Golemancer's Bell to make Colored Marks, which some Cores can use for greater control.                         The Entropy Upgrade will cause damage to anything that damages the Golem.

quests.name: Advanced Golemancy
quests.description: With the creation of so many Golems and Upgrades, the process and understanding of what makes a Golem a Golem becomes much easier, we've noticed. Little things can be done to improve Golems, whether its a combination of Core and Upgrades that does something special, or just better knowledge how to control them with the Golemancer's Bell.                           We can imbue a bit more magic into our creations to improve them even further. Increase the power and life in them helps improve their abilities. Your Infusion Altar will help immensely. Do note, that to place a Golem onto a Pedestal, you'll need to Sneak + Right Click, otherwise it will consider the Pedestal it's Home location instead.

tasks.longDescription: Well, it isn't adding Legs to it, but it'll do. You can infuse the Hungry Chest with more energy, and it will becoming a Traveling Trunk.               The Trunk will hop around, following you, acting like a normal Chest to help you store things. It will travel with you to other dimensions as well. You can have it stay by clicking the button in its inventory.                                     The Trunk can take a single Upgrade, which will give it a special ability depending on which one it is given. Like a Golem, it can also be picked up by Left Clicking it with a Golemancer's Bell.

We can do the same thing we did with the Traveling Trunk with any Golem. By imbuing it with more energy and intelligence, it can help us even more.                                An Advanced Golem will have an extra Upgrade slot, though it still will only be able to hold two of a single type.                                    They will also be slightly faster and have a farther range.                Wiggles has a request : Make an Advanced Thaumium Golem!

quests.name: Deeper Understanding
quests.description: Now, the first thing I need to ask you, Bandit, is if you've come across a few strange Obelisks in your world? Perhaps a Sinister Node on its own?                             The Obelisks are strange creations, ones from a darker force. They look like a floating Obsidian pillar, surrounded by a circle of Obsidian looking pedestals. Who created them, I'll cover in a bit, but you MAY have come across them already in your exploration. They are everywhere... followers in blood red robes.                              Sinister Nodes can be easily spotted by the much darker, almost black, patches of grass around them. At night, both these Nodes and the Obelisks are very dangerous places. Creatures that rarely spawn anywhere else can be found there.                               And it is at these that you'll find the means to advance from a simple Thaumaturge to an amazing one.

tasks.longDescription: Now, given I don't know your world beyond this... massive... amount of data the technological branches have given me, I'm not sure how prevailant these Sinister Nodes and Obelisks are. I have a solution though!                                          I have given the shopkeeper, Penny, some special materials that may help you. Wiggles and I have collected many a thing, as have all our assistants and apprentices over the years. Most of them are little scraps of knowledge. You too might be able to find some in your world, perhaps from some of those Villagers?                                     But as I was saying, the General Store now has a stash of items (for sale of course) that can help furthur your Thaumaturge career.

One of the things you'll find, either from Sinister Nodes at night, or from my research materials, is a very very Angry Zombie. Be sure to scan it, and a Brain, with your Thaumometer to start a new line of Research.                                     The Brain in a Jar is basically a reanimated...Re-reanimated Zombie Brain! It feeds off the knowledge and energy of creatures that die near it, storing their XP. Giving the Jar a tap will release some of this XP for yourself.

Normal Thaumium Armor is a decent bit of protection, but with the more dangerous things we'll be dealing with, it just isn't enough. This is where Thaumium Fortress Armor enters the picture!                 Not only does it look better, it provides much more protection. Just like Thaumium Armor, it is highly enchantable as well.                         To Research Fortress Armor, you'll need to Research Infusion Enchanting as well, which should be helpful in its own right!

Now, usually you have to decide between a protective helmet and your Goggles of Revealing...but no more! With the power of the Infusion Altar you can combine the two!                                             The downside is you'll lose the Vis discount the Goggles give you.       But don't worry, the Thaumium Fortress Helm has a bonus : You can Infuse materials into it to create a fearsome mask. A Thaumium Helm can have both a Mask and the Goggles at the same time.

Ah, Wiggles reminded me of something! Have you done the Dark Research quest yet? Or learned how to make a Sinister Lodestone?       Well, the Sinister Lodestone is carved with a symbol that will glow brightly when you are facing toward a Sinister Node...if you are in range of it. It's a good tool to bring with you, I feel, while exploring!

quests.name: Tinkering Delights
quests.description: A somewhat more recent branch of Thaumaturgy deals with tinkering existing ideas and concepts into brand new paths. This includes merging it with technology, delving deeper into Forbidden Knowledge, and working with other magical branches.                                     See, while Wiggles and I are pretty open minded about there being other magic, many Thaumaturges, especially centuries old ones, are a bit stuck in the mud. "Thaumaturgy is the only true magic!" they like saying.                     As, you know, a mage fueling himself with blood energy blasts apart his tower piece by piece. Yep. One true magic.                               Anyways, in your Thauminomicon is a tab marked Thaumic Tinkerer, which will start your Research into this new, different branch.

tasks.longDescription: A simple change to Quartz can be achieved by combining it with Coal or Charcoal, turning its pristine white coloring to a dusky black.

That Enchanted Fabric you learned how to make is great for making objects that are highly enchantable. But what if you get an enchantment you don't want?             Enter the Spellbinding Cloth. With it, you can wipe away Enchantments from an item by merely combining the two in a crafting bench.

By distilling the essences of light and air and bottling it, you get this really useful gas.                      Gaseous Illuminae can be Right Clicked in an area you wish to light up, without having to put down Torches or Lamps.

Usually you have to decide between armor or your Goggles of Revealing. With a little bit of work, though, and a bit of Vis, you can combine a normal Thaumium Helm and your Goggles into a single piece!

quests.name: A Tinkered Flame
quests.description: Taking the idea of the Gaseous Illuminae further, we can create few new items on the same concept of gaseous infusion.

tasks.longDescription: The flip side of the coin of Illuminae, using a vial of Gaseous Tenebrae will instead fill an area with darkness instead of light.
No longer need an area filled with Gaseous light or darkness? Shift + Right Click a Fume Dissipator in the area, and it will get rid of all of the gas nearby.
Hyperenergetic Nitor has a special property to it. As long as it is in your inventory, it will cast a light behind you as you travel.

The Essentia Funnel should help you transfer Essentia between jars.                                            Place a Hopper pointing to the Warded Jar you want to fill, then place this Funnel on top of the Hopper. Right Click another Warded Jar onto the Essentia Funnel, and it'll empty it's contents into the first Jar...if the essentia will fit, that is.

quests.name: Tinkering with Infusion
quests.description: The Hyperenergetic Nitor shows us that we can take Alchemical infusions even further.                    Wiggles is very insistant in me warning you, though, that some of the research you are about to learn can be VERY DANGEROUS.            For reasons of legality and totally NOT because I hate paperwork from accidents, the Q.U.E.S.T. tablet will automatically be labelling the dangerous items.

tasks.longDescription: Now, there are six types of Imbued Fire. Four of them are very dangerous if used wrong.           Ordo is one of the safer Imbued Fires. If you make a pile of Ores and Right Click the Ordo Imbued Fire onto it, and the flames will consume the Ore, and leave around three times the Metal behind.

Did you use Imbued Fire wrong? Do you need to contain it?                 Well, Wiggles and I did warn you. You can 'try' to put out the magical fire with the use of Perdito Imbued Fire, but if it's spread too wide it is probably too late.

When you Research all eight of the Infused Fires, you can then Research something a bit safer.          You can infuse normal Seeds with any of the six basic elements. When you grow them, you'll get Infused Grains.                               When you grow different Aspects in the same soil, they can fuse into Combined Aspect seeds. Infused Seeds will also draw aspects from adjacent plants.           The Thauminomicon has more information on how this system works.

Have a lot of worn down tools you don't want to trash and rebuild from scratch? Well, the Thaumic Restorer can definitely help out.          Hooking up an Essentia Tube system with jars of Instrumentum Essentia to the Restorer will enable it to repair tools you place into it.

quests.name: Tinkered Focus
quests.description: Wand Foci are super useful tools for the skilled Thaumaturge, and we can take them even further with a bit of Tinkering.                       By either combining or altering existing Foci, you can achieve greater and more unique abilities!

tasks.longDescription: The Efreet's Flame enables you to convert materials already placed in the world. The effect is the same as if you smelted the block in a vanilla Furnace : So Cobblestone would turn into Stone, for example.

The Uprising Foci will allow you to fly in the direction you are aiming.                                          A skilled Thaumaturge can time activations of this Foci on long decents to minimize Vis usage while also not splattering against the ground.

By refocusing an Uprising Foci, you can create an air shield around yourself. It will deflect most standard projectiles like Arrows, Snowballs, and Potions.            Do note that it is not strong enough to deflect Fireballs or Wither Skull attacks.
The Telekinesis Foci allows you to move dropped items around on the ground. By Left Clicking, items will gravitate toward where you aim, while Right Clicking will draw them towards you instead.

While the Equal Trade Foci will exchange blocks for other blocks, the Dislocation Foci will instead teleport blocks as a whole, including Chests and their contents.      Right Click a block you want to transport, then Right Click the spot you want to move it. The Vis cost of moving it will be a lot higher than a normal Equal Trade, and even greater if you are Dislocating a Mob Spawner.

The Ender Rift Foci lets you access your Ender Chests, whether it be the basic vanilla Ender Chest, or the special color coded ones.                                     By Right Clicking with the Foci on a color-coded Ender Chest, it will copy the color code and open that chest when used. Shift + Right Clicking will open your vanilla Ender Chest.

quests.name: Mirror Mirror
quests.description: By chance, have you scanned an Ender Pearl yet? It's mirrored, otherworldly surface should help lead you to some new research in your Artifice tab, dealing with Mirror Magic.                                   Mirrors, while being great for looking at yourself, are also fantastic conduits of magic. They, like Ender Pearls, seem to bridge a gap in the void between worlds.

tasks.longDescription: Magic Mirrors work in pairs. You can place one on a wall, then 'bind' a second one to it by Right Clicking it onto the placed Mirror.                  When you have both Mirror's placed, any items thrown into one will come out the other one.               Do note that living things (like you) cannot be teleported between them, and that the more items you send at once, the slower the transfer becomes.

The Magic Hand Mirror can be linked to any placed Magic Mirror, even if it's bound to another one. You can then Right Click the Magic Hand Mirror and put items into it to send them to the other Mirror.           Items can only be be transported FROM the hand mirror.

Essentia Mirrors work just like Magic Mirrors in placing and linking, but they do not transport items between them.                                 Instead, though, it will draw Essentia through, if something like an Infusion Altar draws it.

quests.name: Tinkered Devices
quests.description: We can use the special Thaumic properties of materials in various ways, just by tinkering with them a little.
